div2.entryFree:
qbws *
A sort of Tunobuwr: see maEaAzifu.
1 qabaEa Als~iqaA'a * : see xanava.
qabiyEapN * [The pommel of a sword;] the thing of silver or iron at the extremity of the hilt of a sword. (S, K.)

1 qabala * as syn. with ↓ A^aqobala, q. v.: see A^adobara, in two places. ― -b2- qabaHa All~`hu maA qabala minohu wamaA dabara: see dabar. ― -b3- qabila He took, received, or admitted, willingly, or with approbation; he accepted. See qabuwlN. ― -b4- qabilati Aln~aEolu The sandal had its qibaAl broken. (TA in art. $sE.)

3 qaAbalahu *
He faced, or fronted, or was opposite to or over against, him, or it. (S, * K.) See also ↓ Aisotaqobalahu He, or it, corresponded to him, or it. ― -b2- qaAbalahu binafosihi [He opposed himself to him]. (TA, art. ErD.) See EaraDa lahu; and see 4. ― -b3- qaAbala ka*aA bika*aA He requited such a thing with such a thing; or did, or gave, such a thing in return for such a thing; as good for good, evil for evil, good for evil, or evil for good. (The Lexicons passim.) ― -b4- He counteracted such a thing with such a thing. ― -b5- He compared such a thing &c. ― -b6- quwbila bika*aA It was compensated, or requited, by, or with, such a thing: see an ex. of the part. n. voce gunomN. ― -b7- qaAbala Al$~aAp: see daAbara Al$Ap. ― -b8- farasN quwbila mino A=fiqK waA=fiqapK A horse that is generous with respect to both parents. (S in art. Afq.)

4 A^aqobalotuhu Al$~aYo'a *
I made it to face the thing: (S, K:) and Al$~aYo'a ↓ qaAbalotuhu app. signifies the same: see a verse of El-Aashà voce AirotisaAmN. ― -b2- A^aqobala bihi [He turned it forward; contr. of A^adobara bihi]. (S, K, art. dbr.) ― -b3- A^aqobala He came, facing; (JK, S, * K; *) came forward; came on; advanced; contr. of A^adobara. (S, K.) ― -b4- A^aqobalotu qibalaka [not qubolaka] I advanced, or came, toward thee. Like qaSadotu qaSodaka. (L, art. Hrd.) See also Kur, ii. 172. ― -b5- A^aqobala Ealayohi He advanced, or approached, towards him, or it. ― -b6- A^aqobala EalaY A_inosaAnK, as though he desired no other person. (JK.) ― -b7- AqobaAlN The advancing of fortune; contr. of A_idobaArN. ― -b8- AlA_iqobaAlu fiY Ald~unoyaA [Advance in the world, or in worldly circumstances]. (Mgh in art. jd.) A_iqobaAlN signifies The being fortunate. (KL.) ― -b9- A_iqobaAlN i. q. dawolapN [Good fortune; &c.; see tAmiku]: and Eiz~apN [might; &c.]. (Kull, p. 64.) ― -b10- A^aqobala Ealayohi He showed favour to him: or, more properly, he presented a favourable aspect to him; or, accord. to general usage, he met him kindly; see ba$~a lahu. ― -b11- A^aqobalato Ealayohi Ald~unoyaA, (A, art. ftH,) The world favoured him. ― -b12- A^aqobala EalaY $aYo'K He set about, or commenced, doing a thing. (K, &c.) ― -b13- See taSad~ada. ― -b14- A^aqobala Ealayohi He clave to it: and he took to, set about, began, or commenced it; as also Elyh ↓ qabala. (K.) ― -b15- [A^aqobala Ealayohi biAls~ayofi, and biAlEaSaA, and biAls~awoTi He advanced against him, or set upon him, with the sword, and with the staff or stick, and with the whip.] ― -b16- You say, A^aqobala Ealayoh biAls~awoTi yaDoribuhu [He advanced against him, or set upon him, with the whip, striking him]. (S in art. Hwl.) ― -b17- See qabalN. ― -b18- yuqobilu biAld~alowi A_ilaY Albiy^ori and A^amoru fulaAnK AlaY A_iqobaAlK: see A^adobara. ― -b19- A^aqobal Ealayohi biAlt~aEoniyfi: see Har, p. 165 ― -b20- A^aqobilo EalaY nafosika [Betake, or apply, thyself to thine own affairs]. (T, voce A_ilaY.) ― -b21- dabarato lahu Alr~iyHu baEoda maA A^aqobalato: see dbr. ― -b22- A^aqobala [He recovered, or regained, health;] occurring in the K, as the explanation of vaAba jisomuhu. (K, art. vwb.) A^aqobala baEoda huzaAlK. (K, voce Ha$ama.) ― -b23- A^aqobala, with reference to the slit ear of a she-camel: see A^adobara. ― -b24- A^aqobilonaA bi*im~apK, app. a mistranscription for A^aqolibonaA: see *im~apN.

6 taqaAbaluwA *
They faced, or confronted, one another: see S in art. fqH.

8 Aiqotabalahu *
He began it, or commenced it; namely, an affair; (S, * Mgh, K; *) as also ↓ A_isotaqobalahu. (Mgh.)

10 Aisotaqobalahu * : see Aisotadobarahu. He faced him, or it. (TA) He turned his face towards him, or it. ― -b2- He came before his face. ― -b3- He went to meet him; he met him, or encountered him. He saw it before him: he looked forward to it: he saw it, or knew it, beforehand. He saw, or knew, at the beginning of it what he did not see, or know, at the end thereof. ― -b4- Astqblhu biA^amorK (T, S, K, &c., in art. bdh) He met him, or encountered him, with a thing. or an affair, or an action. (TK in art. bdh.) ― -b5- Astqblhu bimaA yakorahu (A, K, in art. bkt, &c.) He encountered him with, or, as it often means, he accused him, to his face, of a thing that he disliked, or hated: see bak~atahu; and the phrases Aalbohtu A@sotiqobaAluka A^axaAka bimaA layosa fiyhi and biAlka*bi ↓ qaAbalahu, voce bahatahu; and Astqblhu biAlHaq~i, voce qaraHahu; in both senses like laqiyahu bimakoruwhK. ― -b6- Aisotaqobalotuhu bikalaAmK fiyhi giloZapN [I encountered him, or confronted him, with speech in which was roughness]. (JK, M, TA, art. jbh.) ― -b7- Aisotaqobalahu He anticipated it; namely, Ramadán, by fasting before its commencement. (TA.) ― -b8- See 8.

qabolu *
Before; contr. of baEodu; (S, K, &c.;) an adv. n. of time; and, as some say, of place also; (MF, TA;) and of rank, or station. (TA.)

saqaYA_ibilahu qabalFA * [and biAlqabali] He poured the water into the trough while his camels were drinking, so that it came upon them: (T, TA:) or qabalN signifies a man's bringing his camels to water, and drawing the water over their mouths, not having prepared for them aught [thereof] before that: (As, TA:) and saqaY EalaY A_ibilihi qabalFA he poured the water over the mouths of his camels: (M, TA:) and EalaY A_ibilihi ↓ A^aqabola he drew the water over the heads of his camels while they drank,
when they had drunk what was in the trough, (Lh, M, TA,) not having prepared it before that: and this is the most severe mode of watering. (Lh, TA.) ee an ex. voce jabFA, art. jbw and jbY. ― -b2- nabalN is opposed to dabarN: see the latter. ― -b3- n~a AlHaq~a biqabalK Verily the truth is manifest; where one sees it. (TA, art. Ejz.) ― -b4- mino *iY qabalK: see mino *iY EawoDK; and see qibalN; and A^unufN. ― -b5- A_i*aA raA^ayota Al$~iEoraY biqabalK Alx: see M, art. dbr.

laqiytuhu qibalFA *
I met him face to face. (JK.) ― -b2- laA A^ukal~imuka AilaY Ea$orK mino *iY qibalK i. q. ↓ mn *Y qabalK, i. e. [I will not speak to thee until ten nights] in what I [now] begin [of time]: or the latter, until ten [nights] which thou [now] beginnest: and the former, until ten [nights] of the days which thou [now] witnessest, (K, TA,) i. e. beginnest: (TA:) or the latter, of a time [now] begun; or, a future time. (Mgh, Msb.) And A^atayotu qulaAnFA manu *iY qibalK i. q. A=nifFA. (Lth in T, art. Anf.) ― -b3- qibala Towards. (Bd. ii. 172.) qibalu $aYo'u What is next to a thing: you say, *ahaba qibala Als~uwqi [he went to the part next to the market]. (TA.) liY qibalahu maAlN I have property in his hands; i. e. due, or owing, to me by him; syn. Einodahu [q. v.] (K, * TA.) And lanaA qibalaka HaAjapN: (S in art. rwY &c.:) see rawiy~apN (and Einoda also). ― -b4- h`*aA AlA^amoru mino qibalihi This thing, or affair, is from him; syn. mano tiloqaAy^ihi and mano ladunohu, meaning mino Einodihi. (Lth, TA.) yatakal~amu mino qibali A^anofihi [He speaks from (i. e. through) his nose]. (JK and K, voce A^adogamu.) ― -b5- Aino$aq~a mn qibali nafosihi It (a garment) rent of itself. (L, art. Swx, &c.)

qubulN * The front, or fore part. See Kur, xii. 26. The former or first part: see dafay^iy~N. ― -b2- Alqubulu The anterior pudendum (faroj) [vulva, and vagina,] of a man or woman; (Msb;) opposite of Ald~uburu. (S, K.)
maA lahu qibolapN walaA diborapN * , &c.: see dbr.
qabaliY~N * : see dabariY~N.
qibaAlu Al$~ibori * and Al$~isoEi: see $iborN. ― -b2- fulaAnN maA yadoriY qibaAla AlA^amori mano dibaArihi; &c.: see dbr. ― -b3- qbaAlN of the sandal: see zimaAmN.

qabuwlN *
Favourable reception; acceptance; approbation: (KL PS:) love, and approbation, and inclination of the mind. (TA.) EalaY fulaAnK qabuwlN [Approbation is bestowed upon such a one;] the mind accepts, or approves, such a one. (S.) ― -b2- qabuwlN Goodliness, beauty, grace, comeliness, or pleasingness: and [beauty of] aspect or garb. (K.) [And Acceptableness. Ealayohi qabuwlN may be rendered Upon him, or it, is an appearance of goodliness, &c.]
qabiylN * : see dabiyrN. ― -b2- qabiylN Kind, species, class, race. mino qF Of the kind, &c. See qabiylapN.

jaA='a qubayola *
He came a little while ago; syn. A=nifFA. (M in art. Anf.)

qubaAlatahu *
Opposite to, in a position so as to face, him or it. (K, &c.) See HiyaAlN in art. Hwl. ― -b2- qubaAlapN The direction, point, place, or tract, in front of a thing; the opposite direction &c.

qabiylapN *
A body of men from one father and mother: and ↓ qabiylN, without p, a body of men from several ancestors. (Az in TA, art. sbT.) ― -b2- qabiylapN: see $aEobN. ― -b3- A mass of stone or rock at the mouth of a well. (K and TA voce EuqaAbN, q. v.) See qaAbilN.

EaAmN qaAbilN * , and ↓ muqobilN, signify the same, [A nextcoming year]. (S.) AlqaAbilapu i. q. All~ayolapu Almuqobilapu [The next night]. (S, K.) See AlqubaAqibu. ― -b2- qaAbilN lika*aA Susceptible of such a thing. ― -b3- qaAbilN An arrow that wins [in the game of Almayosir]; (TA, art dbr;) contr. of daAbirN, q. v. (S and TA, art. dbr.) ― -b4- qabaAy^il of the head: see $aA^onN. ― -b5- And ↓ qabiylap of a helmet: see TiraAqN. ― -b6- qaAbilapN A wife. (TA in art. Ezb.)
qaAbiliy~apN * [The quality of admitting or receiving; susceptibility].
A^aqobalu lilomawoEiZapi * [More, or most, inclined to accept admonition]. (TA, art. rq.]
A_iqobaAlapN * and its syn. A_iqobaAlN: see 4; and see A_idobaArapN.
muqobilN * : see qaAbilN. ― -b2- [I. q. muqotabalN]. Ex. maqobilapN Alr~aHomi (K, voce jawaAriHu,) and Al$~abaAbi. (TA, ibid.) See madobirN.
vagorN baAridu Almuqab~alN * [A mouth, or front teeth, cold, or cool, in the part that is kissed]. (A, art. xSr, &c.)

AlmuqaAbalu mina AlmanaAzili *
contr. of AlmudaAbaru, (M, art. dbr, q. v.) ― -b2- muqaAbalN Noble, by the father's and mother's side: (S, K, TA:) see an ex. voce TaAbN; and see A_izodawajaA. ― -b3- muqaAbalapN applied to a ewe: see mudabarapN. ― -b4- naAqapN muqaAbalapN mudaAbarapN: see dbr. ― -b5- Aljaboru wAlmuqaAbalapu: see jbr. ― -b6- fiY muqaAbalapi ka*aA In comparison with such a thing: see an ex. in art. gyn in the Msb.
musotaqobalN * , with fet-h to the b, Looked forward to, anticipated, begun.
masotaqibolu Almajodi * : see musotadibor.

qab~aAnN *
A steelyard: see Eamuwdu AlmiyzaAni.

qabaA='N * [A kind of tunic, resembling the qafotaAnN, generally reaching to the middle of the shank, divided down the front, and made to overlap over the chest. So in the present day. See also Dozy, Dict. des noms de vêtements, pp. 352-62.]

2 qat~arahu *
He prostrated him upon his side, EalaY qutorihi [not ElY qutorahK, as in the K]; (L;) he threw him down upon one of his two sides, EalaY A^aHadi qutorayohi, having pierced him [with a spear]; (JK;) like qaT~arahu.

A_ibonu qitorapa *
The Hay~ap. (T in art. bnY.)

jawobN qaAtirN *
A shield of good dimensions. (S.) See yalabN.

1 qatala Al$~aYo'a * , inf. n. qatolN, (assumed tropical:) He knew the thing; he was, or became, acquainted with it: (Msb:) [or rather, i. q.] qatalahu EilomFA, (Bd in iv. 156, and TA,) and xuborFA, (K,) and biEilomihi, (Bd, ubi supra,) he knew it (Bd, K, TA) completely, (TA,) or thoroughly, very well, or superlatively well; as also naHarahu EilomFA. (Bd.) See A^avobata Al$~aYo' maEorifapF in art. vbt.
2 qat~ala * : see a verse cited in art. Etb, conj. 4.

3 qaAtalahu *
He fought, or combated, him; contended with him in fight or conflict or battle. qaAtala EalaY diyin A@ll~`hi: see 3 in art. AzY.
5 taqat~alato lahu * means taxaD~aEato lahu wata*al~alato Hat~aY Ea$iqahaA. (A.)

10 Aisotaqotala * [properly He sought, or courted, slaughter;] i. q. AisotamaAta; (S, K;) meaning he cared not for death, by reason of his courage; (JM;) he resigned and subjected himself to slaughter, and cared not for death. (Mgh.)
qatolN * : from this word is formed the pl. qutuwlN, on the authority of hearsay. (El-Jurjánee, in Msb, art. qSd.)
qat~aAlN * [Murderous; slaughterous; very deadly.] You say Hay~apN qat~aAlahN [A very deadly serpent]. (TA in art. ASl.)

qaAtilN *
Deadly; applied to a tree; (K in art. xmT;) and to poison. (TA in that art.)

maqotalN *
A [vital] place in a man [or an animal, i. e.] where a wound causes death; (S, Msb;) as the temple: (Msb:) pl. maqaAtilu. (S.)
walin~iY maqaAtilaka * means Haw~ilo A_ilaY~a wajohaka. (A.)
musotaqotilN * : see musotamiytN.
1 qatuna * : see qanuta.
qatiynN * : see qaniytN.

1 qaHaza *
It (an arrow) rose in the sky. (JSh, in TA, art. $xS.)
qiHofN * : see jumojumapN, in two places; ― -b2- and qid~N. ― -b3- A glass bowl; as also jumojumapN. (Az, TA in art. jm.)
qaHuwlN * , applied to a man and to a horse, i. q. Ein~iynN. (IAar in TA, art. Ejr.)
A_inoqaHolN * ; see A_inozahowN.
1 qHm nafosahu fiY AlA^umuwri * and fyhA ↓ tqHm~ and ↓ AqtHm He entered into affairs without consideration. (A.)

5 taqaH~ama *
He experienced dearth, drought, or sterility. See an ex. voce tabiEapN. ― -b2- taqaH~ama fiY AlA^amori bilAa rawiy~apK [He plunged, or rushed, into the affair without consideration]. (K, * TA in art. ElT.) See 1. ― -b3- taqaH~ama: see tadal~ava.
8 A_iqotaHama * . See 1. ― -b2- Said of a young camel: see voce bulaEN. ― -b3- AiqotaHama AlgamarAati: see 1 in art. xwD. And AqtHm AlEaqabapa: see EaqabapN.
qaHomapN * , like qaHobapN, An old woman. See qaHobN.

muqoHamN *
Redundant; pleonastic; foisted in: applied to a word and to a letter. ― -b2- HarofN maqoHamapN A letter inserted without reason. muqoHamapN is also applied in like manner to a word. [In a copy of the S, in art. bht, I find it written muqoHimapN]: i. q. zaAy^idapN. (TA in art. bht.)
A^uqoHuwaAnN * : see baAbuwnajN. See also a verse cited voce tan~uwmN.
qaAduwsN * (pl. qawaAdiysu) An earthen or wooden pot of a water-wheel. (PU.)

1 qadaEa farasahu *
He pulled in his horse by the bridle and bit, to stop him; (S, K;) he curbed, or restrained, him. (S.) ― -b2- huwa AlfaHolu laA yuqodaEu A^anofuhu: see A^anofN; and see qrE.

1 qadama Alqawoma * , aor.
qaduma , inf. n. qadomN (S, * Msb, K) and quduwmN; (K;) and ↓ taqad~amahumo; (S, * Msb, K;) and ↓ qad~amahumo; and ↓ Aisotaqodamahumo; (K:) He became before the people: (TA:) syn. sabaqahumo; (Msb;) he preceded them; went before them; took precedence of them; headed them; led them, so as to serve as an example, or object of imitation. ― -b2- See A^am~ahumo. ― -b3- qadima Albalada, aor.
qadama , inf. n. quduwmN and maqodamN, [He came to, or arrived at, the town, &c.] (Msb.) A^axo*aniY maA qaduma wamAa Haduva: see art. Hdv. ― -b4- qadima EalaY AlA^amori i. q. Ealayohi ↓ A^aqodama [He advanced boldly to undertake the affair]. (TA.) See an ex. in a verse voce muDaAfN. ― -b5- See 6.

2 qad~ama zayodFA A_ilaY AlHaAy^iTi *
He brought Zeyd near, or caused him to draw near, or to approach, to the wall. (Msb.) ― -b2- qad~amahu He put it forward; offered it; proffered it. ― -b3- He brought, and brought forward, him or it. ― -b4- qad~ama lahu TaEaAmFA He proffered, offered, or presented to him, food. ― -b5- qad~ama He did good or evil previously, or beforehand: (Bd, and Jel in xxxvi. 11; &c.:) he laid up in store. (Bd in xii. 48.) See zal~afahu. ― -b6- qad~ama He made foremost; put, brought, or sent, forward; he advanced him or it: he promoted him. ― -b7- qad~amahu EalaY gayarihi, inf. n. taqodiymN, He made him, or it, to be before, or have precedence of, another, in time: and in place; i. e. he placed, or put, him, or it, before another; or made him, or it, to precede another: and in rank, or dignity; i. e. he preferred him, or it, before another; or honoured, or esteemed, him, or it, above another. (Kull, p. 104.) ― -b8- qad~amahu lika*aA He prepared it, or provided it beforehand, for such a thing. See Kur, xii. 48. ― -b9- qad~ama Einoda A@ll~`hi xayorFA He prepared, or provided in store, for himself, good, [i. e. a reward,] with God. (A and Mgh in art. Hsb.) ― -b10- qd~m lahu Alv~amana He paid him in advance, or beforehand, the price. ― -b11- qad~ama A^ano PafoEala ka*aA He preferred doing such a thing; syn. A=vara, i. e. faD~ala. (M in art. A^avr.) [Hence, qad~ama AlEajoza fiYAl$~aYo'i He preferred backwardness with respect to the thing.] (See far~aTa and furuTN: and see Kull, p. 279.) ― -b12- qad~ama syn. with taqad~ama, q. v.: like as A^ax~ara is with taA^ax~ara: so in the Kur, xli. 1. (TA, art, A^xr.) ― -b13- qad~ama [is trans. and intrans.: for its significations as an intrans. v., see its syn. tqd~m, and see 1:] as a trans. v. it is contr. of A^ax~ara. (Msb, art. A^xr.) ― -b14- qad~ama is syn. with badaA^a bihi. (Mgh and Msb in art. bdA^.) ― -b15- qad~ama A_ilayohi fiY ka*aA: see taqad~ama. ― -b16- See taA^a*~ana voce A=*ana. ― -b17- qad~ama A^awolaAdFA and qad~amatohumo: see A^aforaTa. ― -b18- qad~amahu and ↓ A^aqodamahu He urged him forward. (Mo'allakát, 157.) ― -b19- qad~ama has taqodimapN for an inf. n.

4 A^aqodama *
He was bold, or audacious. ― -b2- A^aqodama EalaY AlA^amori He ventured upon, or addressed himself to, the thing boldly, courageously, or daringly; (S, K;) he attempted it. ― -b3- A^aqodama ElY qironihi He behaved boldly, courageously, or daringly, against his adversary; (Msb;) he attached him. ― -b4- See 1. ― -b5- A^aqodimo, (improperly A_iqodimo,) said to a horse, Advance boldly! (S.) So rendered voce A^ahaAba, and habo.

5 taqad~ama *
He was, or became, or went, before, or ahead; preceded; had, or took, precedence; contr. of taA^ax~ara, q. v. See 1. ― -b2- taqad~ama A_ilaY AlHaAy^iTi He drew near, or approached, to the wall. (Msb.) ― -b3- taqad~ama He advanced; went forward, or onward. (L, art. qwd.) ― -b4- taqad~ama EalaY AlHaq~i: see Bd, xviii. 27. ― -b5- taqad~ama He became advanced, or promoted. ― -b6- taqad~ama minohu kalAamN: see faraTa: but the primary meaning is, Speech proceeded from him previously. ― -b7- taqad~ama EalaY gayorihi quasi-pass. of qad~amahu EalaY gayorihi; He, or it, was, or became, before, or had precedence of, another, in time: and in place; i. e. he, or it, was, or became, before another; preceded another; went before another: and in rank, or dignity; i. e. he, or it, was, or became, preferred before another; or honoured, or esteemed, above another: in all these senses like taqad~ama gayorahu. See bak~ara. ― -b8- taqad~ama fiY A^amorK [He was forward in an affair] qabola fiEolihi [before doing it]. (A'Obeyd, T in art. rmY.) ― -b9- taqad~ama i. q. sabaqa; (K, art. sbq, &c.;) and contr. of taA^ax~ara. (TA, art. A^xr.) ― -b10- taqad~ama A_ilayohi fiY ka*aA, (K,) or bika*aA, (Msb,) or both, (Mgh,) He commanded, ordered, bade, charged, or enjoined, him respecting, or to do, such a thing; (Mgh, Msb, K;) as also ↓ qad~ama, inf. n. taqodiymN. (Msb.)
6 taqaAdama * is best rendered It became old: and ↓ qaduma it was old.

8 AiqotadaY bihi *
He did as he did, following his example; or taking him as an example, an exemplar, a pattern, or an object of imitation. (Msb.) He followed his example, imitated him; &c.

10 Aisotaqodama *
He went before. ― -b2- Aisotaqodamato riHaAlatuka: see art. rHl.

qadamN * The human foot, from the ankle downwards. (Mgh.) ― -b2- lahu qadamN raAsixapN fiY AlEilomi: see art. rsx. ― -b3- EalaY qadamK EaZiymK On an excellent foundation. ― -b4- fulaAnN EalaY qadami fulaAnK Such a one is successor of such a one.

qidamN *
Oldness; antiquity. ― -b2- Existence, or duration, or time, without beginning; like A^azalN (Kull, p. 31; &c.) See A^azalN. ― -b3- EalaY wajohi Ald~ahori: qidamu Ald~ahori means properly the olden time; antiquity. ― -b4- ElaYa qidami Ald~ahori [In, or from, old, or ancient, time; of old]. (S, M, K, art. A^s; in the first and last of which it is coupled with the like phrase.)
mino qudumK * [In front]. (K, voce ZunobuwbN.) ― -b2- qudumN: see A^uxurN.
qAadimapN * as applied to a part of a camel's saddle is an improper word: the proper term is waAsiTN.

qaduwmN *
An adz; [so in the present day, but pronounced qad~uwm;] a certain implement of the carpenter; (S, Mgh, Msb;) a faA^os with which one hews, or forms or fashions by cutting. (S.)

qadiymN *
Ancient; old; to which no commencement is assigned. ― -b2- maAlN qadiymN Old, or long-possessed, property. (S, A, Mgh, Msb, all in art. tld.) ― -b3- qadiymN The reputation (HasabN) of a man or people. (TA, art. dvr.) See a verse in 1 of art. vnY. ― -b4- Alqadiymu, as an epithet applied to God, i. q. Alqadiymu AlA^azaliY~u The Ancient without beginning.
qawAdimu * : respecting the feathers thus called, see voce manaAkibu, and A^aboharu.
jariYo'u Almuqodami * : see art. jrA^. Almuqodam is here syn. with AlA_iqodaAm.

maqodaAmN *
Very bold or daring or courageous (S, K,) against the enemy; (S;) as also maqodaAmapN. (S.) ― -b2- miqodaAmapN: see voce miEozAabap. ― -b3- [The pl.] maqaAdimu Fronts; fore parts. See an ex. voce A^aEovara. ― -b4- maqaAdiymu The front of the forehead. (JK.)

muqad~amN *
A provost, chief, head, director, conductor, or manager. ― -b2- muqad~amN The antecedent (or first proposition) in an enthymeme, and (first part) of a hypothetical proposition. ― -b3- muqad~amapN The van, or vanguard, of an army.

muqad~imapN * The ground whereon rests an inquiry or investigation: and the ground whereon rests the truth of an evidence or a demonstration: and a [premiss or] proposition which is made a part of a syllogism: and Almuqad~imapu Algariybapu is that [premiss] which is both actually and virtually suppressed in the syllogism; as when we say, A is equal to B, and B is equal to C, when it results that A is equal to C, by means of the muqad~imap gariybap, which is, every equal to the equal of a thing is equal to that thing. (KT.)

mutaqad~imN *
Preceding: anterior; being, or lying, in advance of others. ― -b2- mutaqad~imN fiY AlA^umuwri Forward in affairs.
AlA=musotaqodimiyna * in the Kur, xv. 24: see Bd; and see its opposite, AlmusotaA^oxiriyna.
qudowapN * and qidowapN (S, Msb, K,) and qadowapN (K,) A pattern; an exemplar; an example; an object of imitation; one who is, or is to be, imitated. (S, Msb, K, TA.) See A_isowapN.
qidoyahN * : see fidoyahN.
qaAdiyapN * The first that come to one, or come upon one, of a company of men. (TA in art. THm.)

3 qaA*aEahu *
He reviled him, being reviled by him; and vied with him in foul, or unseemly, speech or language. (A, K.) See 3 in art. qdH.

1 qa*afa biA@loHijArapi wagayorihaA * , aor.
qa*ifa , inf. n. qa*ofN, He threw stones, &c. (Msb.) ― -b2- qa*afa bihi He cast it; cast it forth; namely, an arrow, and a pebble, and speech, and anything. (Lth, TA.) It may sometimes be rendered He shed it; as, for instance, light into the heart, said of God. ― -b3- yaqo*ifu biAlHaq~i (Kur, xxxiv. 47,) He (God) uttereth truth. (Zj, TA.) ― -b4- qa*afa biAls~ahomi He shot the arrow. (Lth, TA.) ― -b5- qa*afa He reproached, upbraided, reviled, vilified, defamed, or gave a bad name to, a chaste woman: (MA:) he reproached, upbraided, &c. another; syn. $atama. (JK.) Used tropically, qa*afahu is most correctly rendered (tropical:) He cast at him an accusation: but it is commonly used and expl. as syn. with $atamaha q. v. ― -b6- qa*afa He charged, reproached, or upbraided, (ramaY,) a chaste, or an honest, or a married, woman, with adultery. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b7- qa*afaha bihi He aspersed him, reviled him; syn. $atamahu. (JK.) ― -b8- qa*afaha bihi He reproached, or upbraided, him with it; he accused him of it. (TA.) ― -b9- Also, i. q. A^aSaAbahu bihi. (TA.) ― -b10- wayaqo*ifuwna biAlgayobi (Kur, xxxiv. 52,) They uttering conjectures, (Zj, TA,) or uttering conjecture; (Bd;) speaking of that which was hidden [from them], (Ksh,) of that which had not become apparent to them. (Bd.) ― -b11- qu*ifato biAll~aHomi (assumed tropical:) She (a camel) became fat and plump. (TA, voce AusotuEoriDat.) ― -b12- qa*afatohu AlqawaA*ifu: see Taw~aHatohu AlT~awaAy^iHu.

qu*ufN *
Land in which is no pasturage wherein cattle may freely range. (L, art. SH.)

qa*~aAfN *
i. q. manojaniyqN: (Lth, K:) The kind of instrument with which a thing is thrown so that it goes far; n. un. with p. (Aboo-Kheyreh, K.) See marojaAmN and mirojamapN. ― -b2- qu*~aAfahN A sling: pl. qu*~aAfaAtN. (MA.)
qawaA*ifu * : see TawaAy^iHu; and Taw~aHatohu AlT~awaAy^iHu.
maqaA*ifu * : see maTaAwiHu: Places of perdition; syn. mahaAliku. (TA.)

Alfa*aAlu *
The whole of the back of the head: (S, Msb, K:) or the part from the hollow of the back of the neck (nuqorap AlqafaA) to the ear: (ElGhooree, Mgh:) [see AlqamaHoduwapu in art. qHd:] and, in a horse, the place where the Ei*aAr is tied, behind the forelock. (S, Msb, K.)
1 qa*~aAhu * : see Har~aDahu.

qa*FY *
What falls into the eye; (S, K;) a little piece of wood, or dust, that falls into the eye: (JK:) and what falls into beverage; (S, K;) as flies, &c; (TA;) what betakes itself [or is attracted] to the sides of a vessel, and clings thereto: (AHn, TA:) dust, motes, or particles of rubbish, as of sticks and stalks and straws, or the like, that fall into the eye or into water and beverage: (KL:) any floating particles upon water, &c.: [scum:] dirt that falls into the eye; (Msb;) what collects in the inner angle of the eye; (Har, p. 65;) what comes into the eye, such as a bit of straw, &c.: (Id, p. 149:) [properly a coll. gen. n.:] qa*aApN [the n. un.] a thing that falls into the eye and pains it: (Id, p. 259:) a mote. ― -b2- A^agoDaY ElY qa*FY: see art. gDw.

1 qara$a * , aor.
qari$a , inf. n. qaro$N; and ↓ Aiqotara$a and ↓ taqar~a$a; He gained, acquired, or earned, and collected, for his family. (M.)
5 taqar~a$a and 8: see 1.

quroSN *
A round convex ornament worn on the crown of the tarboosh. (See Modern Egypt. Appendix A.)
quroTN * : see qiraATN.

qiraATN *
A lamp, or its lighted wick: syn. miSobaAHN or $uEolatuhu: (K:) the lighted wick ($uEolap) of a lamp; (S;) and so ↓ quroTN. (L, art. SbH.)

qaroTafN *
A red garment, of the kind called kisaA'. See ka*aba, p. 2598 c.

qiroTaAlapN *
An ass's pannier, one of a pair. See kuwaArapN.

1 qaraEa * in the sense of Daraba has maqoraEN for an inf. n. (Mgh, art. gmz.) ― -b2- qaraEa fiY miqoraEihi i. q. Daraba fiY miDorbihi. (TA in art. Drb.) ― -b3- qaraEa SafaAtahu (tropical:) He impugned his character; blamed or censured him; spoke against him (Mgh, art. gmz.) See magomazN. ― -b4- qaraEa bayona Zufori A_ibohaAmihi waZufori sab~aAbatihi He fillipped with the nail of his thumb and that of his forefinger. (Lth, K, * TA, art. znjr.) ― -b5- huwa AlfaHolu laA yuqoraEu A^anofuhu: see A^anofN and qdE. ― -b6- qaraEa A^anofahu, inf. n. qaroEN, (assumed tropical:) He rejected him, repelled him, or turned him back; namely a suitor in a case of marriage. (TA, in art. bDE.) See buDoEN. ― -b7- A_in~a AlEaSaA quriEato li*iY AlHilomi: see Freytag's Arab. Prov. i. 55; and Har, 656. ― -b8- laA yuqoraEu lahu AlEaSaA: see Freytag's Arab. Prov. ii. 543, and Har, 655, in two places. ― -b9- qaraEahu biEaSaA AlmalaAmapi: see EaSFA. ― -b10- qaraEotu raA^osahu biAlEaSaA and biAls~ayofi: see faraEotu. ― -b11- qaraEa Zunobuwba baEiyrihi: and qaraEa liA^amorihi Zunobuwbahu: &c.: see art. Znb: and qaraEa liloA^amori saAqahu: see saAqN.

2 qar~aEahu *
He reproached him for his crime or the like, saying to him, Thou didst so and so. (TA, voce muvar~ibN.) ― -b2- qar~aEa He took, got, or won, a bet, wager, or stake. (L, in TA, voce nadabN.)
3 qaAraEahu * : see its syn. saAhamahu.

4 A^aqoraEa bayonahumo *
He ordered, or commanded, them to cast, or draw, lots, or to practise sortilege, [among themselves,] for the thing (EalaY Al$~aYo'i): (JM:) [see an ex. in the Mgh, in this art.:] or he prepared, or disposed, them, for doing so, for the thing (ElY Al$Y'): (Msb:) or he cast, or drew, lots, or practised sortilege, among them. (K.) The first explanation is generally preferable. See A^asohama bayonahumo.
6 humaA yataqAaraZaAni Alxayora waAl$~ar~a * : see taqaAraDaA.

Hub~u AlqaroEi *
Worms in the belly. (TA, voce $hdAnj.) But see duwdu AlqaroHi. AlqaroE is not a mistake for AlqaroH: Hab~u AlqaroHi is a corruption, found in medical books: Hb AlqrE is a name of the tape-worm, because each joint of it resembles a grain, or seed, of the gourd. (IbrD.)

qaraEN *
Bare pieces of ground amid herbage. (TA in art. xfY, from a trad.)

quwoEapN * [A lot used in sortilege: lots collectively: sortilege itself. Used in all these senses in the present day, and app. in the classical times.] Daraba AlquroEapa He shuffled, or cast, or drew, lots; performed a sortilege.
qariyEN * ; pl. qaroEaY: see an ex. of the pl. in a prov. cited voce Aisotan~a. ― -b2- huwa qariyEu waHodihi: see wHd.

qaAriEapu AlT~ariyqi *
The higher, or highest, part of the road; the part that is trodden by the passengers; [the beaten way]. (Msb.) In law books expl. as meaning A^aToraAfu AlT~ariyqi; opposed to its jaAd~ap.

qaAriEapN *
A sudden calamity. (K.) See also Bd, and Jel, in xiii. 31, and an ex. voce Ainofaraja.
maqoraEN * : see magomazN.
miqoraEN * : see maDorabN.

miqoraEapN *
A whip: or anything with which one beats: (K:) or a thing with which a beast is beaten: (Az, TA:) or a piece of wood with which mules and asses are beaten: (TA:) [a cudgel: often applied in the present day to a cudgel made of the thick part of a palm-stick; and this, when used in sport, has several splits made in the thicker end, to cause the blows to produce a loud sound:] pl. maqaAriEu. (TA.)

3 qaArafahu *
He was, or became, near to it; meaning some base thing, or the like. (TA.) See qarafN.

qarafN * The mixing with others; [and particularly with others who are diseased or the like]; a subst. from ↓ muqaArafapN: (K:) the being near to [a person, or persons, or a place, infected with] disease: (S, TA:) the being near to pestilence, or epidemic disease. (T in art. tlf.) See talafN.
A^aEoraDati Alqirofapu * signifies A_it~asaEato: (TA, art. ErD:) and Ait~asaEato qirofatuhu signifies kavura mano yat~ahimuhu. (TA, art. lbs.) See voce EaruDa.

maqorifN *
A place of paring off: see an ex. voce SamogN.
qiroqN * : see TubonapN.
qurquEapN * (TA, art. nqD): properly furoquEapN, q. v.

1 qarama *
It gnawed: see EuvayovapN.
qaromN * : see muSoEabN.
quromN * : see $aworaY.
quromapN * : see fuqorapN.
qr~Am * ? A kid. (IAar; in TA, art. Et.) ― -b2- See miqoramapN.
miqoramN * : see miqoramapN.

miqoramapN *
A coverlet of a bed; (Mgh, in arts. qrm and Hbs;) also called miHobasN: (Id, in art. Hbs:) or a thin curtain, accord. to some, figured; as also ↓ miqoramN and ↓ qiraAmN: (Msb:) or this last, a figured curtain. (Msb.)

quromuwSN *
A hollow which a man digs wherein to sit to protect himself from the cold. (Mgh, art. rbD.) See an ex. voce rabaDN.
qiromilN * , pl. qaraAmilu: see suf~apN.

1 qarana $ayoy^FA bi$aYo'K *
He connected, coupled, or conjoined, a thing with a thing. (S.)
3 qaAranahu * , (S,) inf. n. qiraAnN, (S, K,) and muqaAranapN, (K,) He associated with him; became his companion. (S, K.)

4 A^aqorana *
He gave of a thing two by two. (A 'Obeyd in T, in art. bd, voce A^abad~a.) See A^abad~a. ― -b2- A^aqorana Al$~aYo'a, (Msb,) or lil$~aYo'i, (K,) [the latter more probably right,] He was able and strong to do, or effect, &c., the thing; (Msb, K;) He had the requisite ability and strength for it.

qironN *
One who opposes, or contends with, another, in science, or in fight, &c.; (Msb;) an opponent; a competitor; an adversary; an antagonist: or one's equal, or match, in courage, (S, K,) or generally, one's equal, match, or fellow. (K.)

qaronN * One's equal in age; syn. lidapN, (K,) or tirobN: with fet-h when relating to age, and with kesr when relating to fighting and the like. (Har, pp. 572,64.) ― -b2- qaronN, (JK, Msb,) or qaronN mina Aln~aAsi, (S,) [A generation of men;] people of one time (JK, * S, Ez-Zejjájee, Msb,) succeeding another qaron, (JK,) among whom is a prophet, or class of learned men, whether its years be many or few. (Ez-Zejjájee, Msb.) ― -b3- qaronN The part of the head of a human being which in an animal is the place whence the horn grows: (K:) or the side, (S,) or upper side, (K,) of the head: (S, K:) or [more exactly the temporal ridge (see SudogN) i. e.] the edge of the haAmap (which is the middle and main part of the head [i. e. of the cranium]), on the right and on the left. (Zj, in his “ Khalk el-Insán. ”) ― -b4- quruwnN of the head: see a verse cited voce xay~aTa. quruwnN of horses: see A^ajam~u. ― -b5- qaronN of a solid hoof: see jub~apN. ― -b6- qaronN of a desert, the most elevated part. (TA in art. jHf.) ― -b7- qaronu A^aEofara, as meaning A spear-head, see A^aEofaru. ― -b8- qaronN A pod, like that of the locust tree: pl. quruwnN. Occurring often in the work of AHn on plants, and in the TA, &c. See gaAfN. ― -b9- qaronN [A thing] in a she-camel, which is like the Eafal in a woman;
and which is cauterized with heated stones. (AA, TA, in art. Efl.) ― -b10- qaronN An issue of sweat: pl. quruwnN: see two ex. voce san~a.

qaranN * and ↓ qiraAnN A cord of twisted bark which is bound upon the neck of each of the ploughing bulls (K, * TA) and to the middle of which is then bound the luw^map [or whole apparatus of the plough]. (TA.) See fad~aAnN. ― -b2- [The pl.] A^aqoraAnN Sons of one mother from different men. (TA, voce EayonN.) ― -b3- qaranN: see jaEobapN.
quronapN * The “ horn ” of the uterus.
qiraAnN * : see qaranN.
A^abaramFA qaruwnFA * : see baramN.

qariynN *
An associate; a comrade; a companion. (S, K.) qariynapN A connexion; relation. ― -b2- qariynapN [A clause of rhyming prose, considered as connected with the similar clause preceding or following; the two together being termed qryntAn]. (Har, pp. 9, 23.) ― -b3- Also, A context, in an absolute sense. ― -b4- ↓ A^asomaHato qaruwnatuhu and qariynatuhu: see 1 in art. smH.
qaruwnapN * : see qriynN.
A^aqoranu * [Horned; having horns]. (S, voce kar~aAzN [which see]). See an ex. of the fem. qaronaA='u, voce daAna in art. dyn.
miqoranN * : see mixo*afN.
muqar~anN * : see xa$oxaA$N.
Hab~u Alqaranofuli * : see zajaAjN.
1 qaraY AlD~ayofa * is doubly trans.: see a verse cited voce quwhN.

8 AifotaraY * [meaning tatab~aEa: see a verse of Aboo Dhu-eyb, voce xaAfapN, in art. xwf.] It also means He investigated a country or countries. (S, * K, * TA, all in art. qrY; and TA in art. qrw.) He made much and diligent search. (KL.) See also 10 in art. qrA^.

qirFY *
Entertainment for a guest; that with which a guest is entertained. (S.) ― -b2- Water collected in a trough, or tank, for the drinking of beasts: see bay~uwtN: thus explained in the M in art. byt.

qariY~N *
A place where water runs, (T, S,) to, (T,) or in, or into, (S,) meadows, (T,) or a meadow. (S.) See $ayoxN (last sentence). ― -b2- Pl. A^aqoriyapN: see qaro'N.

qaroyapN *
A town, or village; (Msb, TA;) a small balad, smaller than a madiynap: (MF, voce tiromi*:) not well applied to a madiynap unless qualified by an epithet denoting greatness. (TA in art. madiynap.) See Bd, ii. 261.
naAqapN fiY qirowatihaA * : see 4 in art. qrA^.
qariy~apN * [vulg. qaroyap The yard of a ship;] a squared piece of wood upon the head of the mast of a ship. (Az, TA in art. rnH.)

qaAriyahN *
A certain bird. See xuDaAriY~N and tanaw~uTN.
qaArK * for qaAriy^N, q. v.

naAqapN qarowaA'u *
A long-backed she-camel. (IB, in TA, voce hirojaAbN.)
maqorFY * : see 2 in art. Hjl.
maqoruw~N * and maqoriY~N for maqoruwo'N: see art. qrA^.
qazodiyrN * : see qaSodiyrN.
qawosN qazaE * : see quzaHa.
qzAm * : see A^aHoSana.

qasoqaAsN *
I. q. TufayoliY~N. (IKh, TA, art. Tfl.)
1 qasama * and ↓ qas~ama He divided; parted; divided in parts or shares; distributed. ― -b2- qasama A^amorahu, or ↓ qas~amahu: see 3 in art. Edl.
2 qas~ama see 1.

3 qaAsamahu Al$~aYo'a *
He divided with him the thing, each of them allotting to himself his share, or portion. ― -b2- qaAsamahu biA@ll~`hi He swore to him by God.

4 A^aqosama Ealayohi *
He conjured him; he said biHaq~ika. (Mgh, art. Tmr.)

5 taqas~ama *
It (a thing) was, or became, divided, or distributed. (MA.) See an ex. in a verse, voce $at~aAna.

entryFree.hi: It was divided into many parts.

div2.entryFree:
10 Aisotaqosama *
He sought to know what was allotted to him, by means of the A^azolaAm, (S, * Mgh, and Har, p. 465,) and what was not allotted to him. (Mgh, Har.)

qisomN *
A division: (Msb:) and particularly (Msb) a portion, or share. (S, Msb, K.) Pl. A^aqosaAmN. ― -b2- layosa mino A^aqosAami ka*aA It is not a part of such a thing; it does not belong, or appertain, to such a thing; it is independent of such a thing.

qasamN *
A conjurement. See A^aqosama Ealayohi. ― -b2- An oath (S, Msb, K) by God [&c.]. (Msb, K.) An asseveration. ― -b3- waAwu Alqasami The w denoting an oath.

qisomapN * is also used in the sense of maqosuwmN [meaning A thing, or collection of things, divided into portions, or shares]: (Bd and Jel in liv. 28:) a portion, or share; like qisomN: (Msb:) [and portions, or shares; as in the phrase,] nuxoriju TariyqFA mino bayoni qisomapi AlA^aroDi A^awi Ald~aAri [We will exclude a way, or passage, from among the portions, or shares, of the land, or the house]. (Mgh in art. rfE.)

entryFree.hi: An officer of the Kádee, who divides inheritances.

div2.entryFree:
3 qaAsaAhu *
He endured it; struggled, or contended, with, or against, it; struggled, or contended, with, or against, its difficulty, or severity; he endured, or he struggled, or contended, with, or against, the difficulty, or trouble, or inconvenience, that he experienced from it or him; [and so EaAnaAhu; for both of which see Har, p. 564; and for the latter see $aAqaAhu; and for both see also mujaAnaApN]; syn. kaAbadahu, (S, K,) and EaAlaja $id~atahu: (TA:) he underwent difficulties, troubles, or inconveniences, in doing it. (Msb in explanation of the syn. kaAbadahu.)
quisiY~u * pl. of qawosN.
qusawiY~N * : see art. qws.

qa$~N *
Stubble; stalk of corn, &c.; straw. q$~ AlbaHor Seaweed. qa$~N Rushes of which mats are made. HaSiyrap q$~ A mat of rushes.
qa$~aA$N * : see ram~aAmN.

1 qa$aEati Alr~iyHu Als~aHaAba *
The wind removed, or cleared off, the clouds; (S, K;) as also ↓ A^aqo$aEatohu. (K.)
4 A^aqo$aEa * and ↓ Ainoqa$aEa and ↓ tq$~E It (a cloud) became removed, or cleared off. (S, K.) See 1.
5 taqa$~aEa see 4.
7 A_inoqa$aEa see 4.

1 qa$ifa * , inf. n. qa$afa, He was coarse in his
living: this is the original signification: he was neglectful of cleanliness: (Msb:) he was neglectful of washing and cleanliness; unfrequent in paying attention thereto; slovenly with respect to his person: (M, Msb:) and ↓ taqa$~afa signifies the like. (Msb.) ― -b2- qa$ifa, inf. n. qa$afN, He became sunburnt. (M.)
5 taqa$~afa see 1.
qu$aAmapN * : see qamo$N.
1 qaSaEa * : see an ex. voce SaAd~apN.

qaSoEapN *
A bowl not so large as a jafonap, but next to it in size, that satisfies ten: (S, voce SaHofap:) it is a wooden bowl. ― -b2- qaSoEapu AlmasaAkiyni: see Alfak~apu.
A^axa*otuhu muqaASaEapF * : see muEaAqaSap.
nabaAtN qaSiyfN ray~Anu * [A weak, or fragile, sappy plant]. (TA, in art. xrE.)
1 qaSala * : see xaSala.
qaSalN * of wheat and barley: see juraAmapN.

qaSiylN *
Corn, or seed-produce, (K,) or barley, (Msb,) cut while green, (Msb, K,) for fodder. (Msb.)
miqoSalN * : see maxoSalN.

qayoSuwmN *
Artemisia abrotanum, or southern-wood; also called qayoSuwmN *akarN: and qayoSuwmN A^unovaY is applied to santolina.
2 qaS~aY * : see qaS~aSa.
5 taqaS~aY * : see taqaS~aSa. ― -b2- taqaS~aY $uroba AlmaA='i flm ysy^r mnh $yA^ [He drank the water to the uttermost, not leaving any of it remaining]. (TA, in art. $f.) ― -b3- See 10.

10 AisotaqoSaY *
He went to the utmost length, or point, in a question, (K,) and in like manner you say, AisotaqoSaY AlA^amora and ↓ taqaS~aAhu. (TA.) ― -b2- [He exhausted a subject. ― -b3- He proceeded to extremities. He was, or became, extreme, in an action, &c.] ― -b4- AisotaqoSaY masoA^alatahu [He went to the utmost point in questioning him, or asking him,] respecting a thing, so as to draw forth the utmost that he possessed [of information respecting it]. (S, art. nS.) ― -b5- AisotaqoSaY fiY AlmasoA^alapi and ↓ taqaS~aY (S, K) both signify the same; (S;) (tropical:) He reached, or attained, [and elicited, and investigated,] the utmost [that was to be reached, &c.] in the question: (K, TA:) and in like manner AstqSY AlA^amora and ↓ tqS~Ahu (TA) (tropical:) [He investigated, or searched, to the utmost the case, or affair;] he reached, or attained, the utmost of the case, or affair, in investigating it. (MA in explanation of the former phrase.) ― -b6- AisotaqoSaY Eilomahu He attained the utmost knowledge of it. ― -b7- AisotaqoSaY maA Einoda naAqatihi mina Als~ayori [He elicited, or exacted, the utmost of his she-camel's pace, or power of going on]. (TA, art. nS.) ― -b8- AisotiqoSaA='N, metonymically, signifies (tropical:) The being niggardly, stingy, or avaricious. (Az, TA in art. dnq.) ― -b9- AisotaqoSayotu AlmakaAna [?] i. q. AisotaEo*ayotuhu. (TA in art. E*Y.)
HuToniY AlqaSaA * , and AlqaSaA='a: and HaATuwnaA AlqaSaA='a: &c.: see art. HwT, and see 1 in art. Hbw.
quSoyaA * is like dunoyaA and EuloyaA, with w changed into Y. (ISd in TA, voce buqowaY.)

qaDoqaADN * , (K,) and some say qaSoqaASN, (TA,) The A^u$onaAn of Syria: (K, TA:) or the green, and lank (saboT), thereof: (Ibn-'Abbád, TA:) or a species of trees of the [kind called] HamoD, (AHn, K, TA,) slender and yellow. (AHn, TA.) See firosN.

qaDiyfN *
Lean, or light of flesh. (TA in art. $lw.)

1 qaDima *
He crunched, nibbled or gnawed? See xaDima: and see also Freytag's Arab. Prov. ii. 245.
qaDaAmN * : see xuDaAmapN.
maqoDamN * : see xuDaAmapN.

qaDiymN * as meaning A skin &c. has for pl. A^aqoDimapN [a pl. of pauc.] and quDumN, and quDomN, accord. to Sb, is a quasi-pl. n., (TA,) and qaDamN is a pl. [or quasi-pl. n.] thereof as meaning a white skin upon which one writes. (S, K.) See an ex. of quDumN voce EasiybN.

1 qaDaY *
He finished a thing entirely, by word, or by deed. This is the primary meaning. (Bd, ii. 111.) By word, as in waqaDaY rab~uka (Idem, ibid.) And thy Lord hath commanded decisively. (Idem, xvii. 24.) And by deed, as in faqaDaAhun~a saboEa sam`waAtK [Kur, xli. 11, And he completed them seven heavens]. (Idem, ii. 11.) ― -b2- And He (God) desired a thing so as to necessitate its being. (Idem, ii. 11.) ― -b3- A_i*aA qaDaY A^amorFA, [Kur, ii. 111,] When He (God) desireth a thing to be. (Bd, Jel.) ― -b4- [Thus it signifies He decreed a thing; ordained it; pronounced it; or decided it judicially.] ― -b5- qaDaY Ealayohi, aor.
qaDiYa , inf. n. qaDaA='N &c., He decided judicially, or judged, against him; and bayona AlxaSomayoni between the two litigants. (TA.) See qadorN. ― -b6- [He completed; accomplished; or fully performed; a thing.] ― -b7- qaDaY He attained, or obtained, or accomplished, his want. (Msb.) ― -b8- [He paid, discharged, or satisfied, a debt, due, claim, or demand.] ― -b9- qaDayotuhu Haq~ahu I gave him [or paid him] his due, (Msb,) fully. (Har, p. 22.) ― -b10- qaDaY Eanohu (S, K, in art. jzY, &c.) He, or it, payed; or made, or gave, or rendered, satisfaction; for him. (TK in that art.) And followed by $ayoy^FA [He paid a thing for him, or in his stead; gave, or rendered, it as a satisfaction; lit. and fig.] (S, TA in that art., and Bd in ii. 45.) See jazaY Eanohu; and see a verse cited voce daAna, in art. dyn. ― -b11- He finished doing a thing: he finished his prayer. (TA.) He performed, fulfilled, or accomplished, the pilgrimage, syn. A^ad~aY, (Msb,) and the religions rites and ceremonies of the pilgrimage, (Bd, Jel in ii. 196,) syn. qaDaYa bihi. (Jel, ibid, Msb.) ― -b12- You also say, Hakama bihi He decreed it; &c.; like Hakama bihi: see an ex. voce suloTaAnN. ― -b13- qawoluhu mam~aA yaqoDiY AlEajaba [His saying such a thing is of the things that induce wonder in the utmost degree]. (TA in art. jlb.) See Har, p. 22. ― -b14- waqaDayonaA A_ilaY baniY A_isrAy^iyla (Kur, xvii. 4): see A_ilaY. ― -b15- qaDuwa: see gazuwa, and hayuw^a, and buTuA=na; and see TamuEa in the S.

3 qaADaAhu *
He cited him before a judge. (TA.)
5 taqaD~aYa see 7.

6 taqAaDaAhu Ald~ayona *
He took, or received, from him the debt. (M, K.) ― -b2- See 10. ― -b3- And see ta$aArayaA.
7 AnqDY * and ↓ tqD~Y It passed away; came to an end, or to nought; became cut off. (K, TA.)

8 AiqotaDaY ka*aA *
It required such a thing: it required the inference of such a thing: it necessarily implied, or involved, such a thing as its consequence or concomitant; it required such a thing to be conceded; it necessitated such a thing. ― -b2- AiqotaDaAhu Haq~ahu He demanded of him his due. (MA.) ― -b3- A_iqotaDayotu minohu Haq~iY I took, or received, from him my due. (Mgh, Msb.)

10 AisotaqoDayotahu *
I demanded of him the giving [or payment] of my due, (Msb, K, *) or debt; (K;) and in like manner dayoniY ↓ taqaADayotuhu and bidayoniY. (Mgh.)

qaDaA='N * a term of the law; opposed to A^adaA='N, which see: and see an ex. cited voce SaH~a. ― -b2-
A decree; an ordinance; a sentence, or a judicial decision. See EuwdN, HukomN and diynN. ― -b3- qaDaA='N The exercise of the office of a kádee. [You say] AlqaDaA='u jamorN [meaning, the exercise of the office of a Kádee is one that often leads to hell]. (L, art. Ewd.)

qaDiy~apN *
A thing; an affair; a matter; a case; an event; an action: significations well known, but not found by me in any classical writing, nor in any lexicon, excepting as implied when the word is used in explanations: syn. A^amorN and $aA^onN. ― -b2- A case of law. (L in art. jhd.) ― -b3- qaDiy~apN kul~iy~apN [A universal or general prescript, rule, or canon]. (Kull, voce qaAEidap, p. 290; KT, in explanation of the same word.) ― -b4- qaDiy~apN in logic, A proposition.
muqotaDaY * [Exigence.] ― -b2- muqotaDaY All~afoZi That which the word, or expression, indicates. (ElFárábee, Msb, voce muEonFY.)

2 qaT~aEahu biAlD~arobi *
He mangled him with beating. ― -b2- taqoTiyEN (tropical:) [A griping, or cutting pain, in the bowels;] i. q. magoSN in the belly; (S, K, TA;) as also taqoDiyEN. (TA.) See also quToEN. ― -b3- taqoTiyEu AlS~awoti (K in art. jdf) A repeated interrupting of the voice in singing. (TK in that art.) See jadafa. ― -b4- qaT~aEa, inf. n. taqoTiyEN, He articulated, or spelled, a word. ― -b5- See taqoTiyEN.

3 qaATaEahu *
He separated himself from him, with the latter's concurrence; see faArazahu; and see AinoqaTaEa Eanohu. ― -b2- qaATaEaA They disunited themselves, each form the other; severed the bond of friendship that united them, each to the other; contr. of waASalaA. (K.) See 6.

5 taqaT~aEa * for qaT~aEa: see S, voce xaTara. ― -b2- taqaT~aEa: see taSar~ama: It (a wound or ulcer) became dissundered, by putrefaction. ― -b3- It (a garment, or a water-skin, &c.) became ragged, tattered, or dissundered, by rottenness. It (milk) became decomposed; it curdled, clotted, or coagulated; i. e. separated into clots.

6 taqaATaEaA * [They became disunited, each from the other; the bond of friendship that united them, each to the other, became severed]; (A, art. ybs;) taqaATuEN signifies the contr. of tawaASulN: (S:) see taSaAramuwA.

7 AunoquTiEa bihi *
He became disabled from prosecuting, or unable to proceed in, or prosecute, his journey, (S, Mgh,) [his means having failed him, or] his means of defraying the expense having gone, or his camel that bore him stopping with him from fatigue, (S, Mgh,) or breaking down or perishing, (Mgh,) or an event having befallen him so that he could not move. (S.) ― -b2- AinoqaTaEa fiY Huj~atihi [He was, or became, cut short, or stopped, in his argument, or plea]. (TA, art. bls.) ― -b3- AinoqaTaEato qiraA='atuhu is said when one is unable to perform [or continue] his recitation, or reading. (TA in art. Ejm.) ― -b4- A_inoqaTaEa mina AlkalAami [or Eani AlklAm (K in art. rjw) He broke off, or ceased, from speech]. (TA, art. blt.) ― -b5- AnqTE AlkalAamu The speech stopped short, or broke off. (TA.) ― -b6- AnoqaTaEa Eanohu [He broke off from him; separated, or disunited himself from him]. See Ainobat~a; and see faATaEahu here. ― -b7- AinoqaTaEa It became cut off, intercepted, interrupted; or stopped; was put an end to; or put a stop to; it stopped, or stopped short, it finished, it failed, it failed altogether; ceased; became extinct; was no longer produced; came to an end. ― -b8- He cut himself off, or became detached, or he detached himself, from worldly things, &c. ― -b9- AinoqaTaEa wasakata mutaHay~irFA [He was, or became, cut short, and was silent, being confounded, or perplexed, and unable to see his right course]. (TA in art. bht.) ― -b10- AinoqaTaEa A_ilaY fulaAnK (tropical:) He made himself solely and peculiarly a companion, or an associate to such a one. (TA.) And AinoqaTaEa A_ilayohi app. signifies (assumed tropical:) He withdrew from a person or persons, or a place, to him, or it: see baA='a A_ilayohi. ― -b11- AinoqaTaEa fuwA^aduhu: see Aino*aEafa.
8 AiqotaTaEa * [He cut off for himself] a piece from a thing: (S:) took a portion from another's property. (Msb.) ― -b2- AifotaTaEa jadiyvahu: see 8 in art. qDb.
quToEN * (assumed tropical:) Pain in the belly, and magoSN. (TA.) See 2.
qiToEN * , applied to an arrow: see maqaATiyE and bariY~N.

qiToEapN *
A piece; bit; part, or portion, cut off, detached, or separated from the whole; a segment; a cutting; a slice; a slip; or the like: a piece, or portion, or parcel, or plot, or spot, of land, ground, herbage, &c.: a distinct quantity or number: somewhat, or some of a number of things. ― -b2- A detached number of locusts: see rijolN: and so of a herd or flock, &c.: and a detached portion. ― -b3- qiToEapN, of poetry: see qaSiydN: pl. qiTaEN, with which ↓ mufaT~aEaAtN is syn.
qaTaEapN * : see jadaEapN. ― -b2- Darabahu biqaTaEatihi: see judomuwrN.

qaTiyEN *
A herd, troop, or drove; a distinct collection or number; of beasts, &c.; a flock, or bevy, of sheep, birds, &c.; a party, or group, or collection, of men, &c.; a pack of dogs. The term “ herd ” is applied to “ a collective number ” of camels by several good writers. We say a “ flock ” of sheep, and of geese; and “ herd ” or rather “ herd ” of goats; and a “ herd ” of oxen or kine, of camels, and of swine, and of antelopes; and a “ swarm ” of bees, &c. ― -b2- qaTiyEN A whip cut from the skin of a camel. ― -b3- qaTiyEapN A portion of land held in fee. See Mgh, Msb. ― -b4- quTiyEapN i. q. hijoraAnN. (S, K.) And qaTiyEapu Alr~aHimi [The cutting, or forsaking, or abandoning, of kindred, or relations; contr. of Silapu Alr~aHimi]. (K, voce HaAliqapN.)
rajulN qaT~aAEN liloA^umuwri * (S, M, A, K, all in art. qDb); see qaD~aAbapN.
A^aqoTaEu All~isaAni * (assumed tropical:) Unable to reply. (AZ in TA, art. bkm.)

taqoTiyEN *
Conformation, or proportion, of a man or beast; lineament of the face: i. q. qad~N, of a man: (K:) and the stature; or justness, or beauty, of the stature; of a man; syn. qaAmapN: (K:) and the cut, shape, fashion, or form, of anything: see an ex. voce zabanN; and also voce qad~N, where it is shown that, being an attribute of a thing as well as of a person, it does not always mean stature or the like: it signifies cut, shape, fashion, or form: and more commonly conformation or proportion: and hence, beauty, or justness, of stature; and simply stature, or tallness: pl. taqaATiyEu, which is more commonly used than the sing. in the present day.

maqoTaEN *
A place of crossing, or traversing, of a river [and a desert, &c.]: (K, TA:) pl. in this sense maqaATiEu. (S.) ― -b2- Also the place of utterance of a letter; like maxorajN. ― -b3- maqoTaEu AlHaq~i: see jalaA='N. ― -b4- qahowapN la*iy*apu AlmqTE: see maz~apN.

maqoTaEapN *
A cause, or means, of cutting off, or stopping: see maHosamapN.

tiyaAbN muqaT~aEapN * [Garments cut out of several pieces] are such as the shirt, and trousers, or drawers, &c. (Mgh in art. vwb.) ― -b2- daraAhimu muqaT~aEapN Dirhems [or coins] that are [clipped, or] light of weight, [or] in which is adulterating alloy: or, as some say, much broken. (Mgh.) ― -b3- AlHuruwfu AlmuqaT~aEapu The letters of the alphabet: so applied in an explanation of Huruwfu AlmuEojami, as syn. with this, in the S in art. Ejm. See also HarofN. ― -b4- See qiToEapN.

A_isotivonaA='N munoqaTiEN *
An exception in which the thing excepted is disunited in kind from that from which the exception is made; contr. of mut~aSilN. ― -b2- munoqaTiEN: see murosalN.

maqaATiyEu *
Heads of spears, or arrows; syn. niSAalN. (L, art. Sld.) See also qiToEN.
qiTofN * A bunch of grapes, &c.: pl. quTuwfN: see an ex. voce *al~ala. ― -b2- qiTofN i. q. maqoTuwfN. (TA in art. bsT.) See basiyTN.
qaTafN * : see baqolN.

qaTaAfN * and ↓ qiTaAfN The time of gathering the crop of grapes: (S, Mgh, K:) or the latter has this meaning; and the former is allowable accord. to Ks: (T, TA:) and the latter is also an inf. n., (Mgh,) or may be so, (Ks, T, TA,) meaning the gathering of the crop of grapes: (Mgh:) [or both have this meaning; for] you say, h`*aA zamaAnu AlqaTaAfi and AlqiTaAfi. (Msb.) See jadaAdN.

qaTiyfN * a coll. gen. n. syn. with qaTaAy^ifu, mentioned in the TA voce A^uboluwjN, which see. ― -b2- qaTiyfapN A villous, or nappy, divaAr [or outer wrapping garment]. (S, Msb, K.) See also rAaHuwlaAtN.
qaTaAy^ifu * : see my 1001 Nights, note 23 to chap. viii. See also zalAabiyah. In the TA, art. knf, it is applied to kunaAfap.
miqoTafN * (vulg. maqoTafN) [pl. maqaATif] A handbasket, made of palm-leaves: so called because originally used in gathering fruit. (See also quf~ap and zanobiyl.)

1 qaTana biAlmakaAni *
He resided in the place. (Msb.)
qaTonu * syn. with qaTo: see the latter.
quTonu AlbarodiY~i * : see barodiY~N.
qaTanN * The part between the two hips, or haunches; (S, K;) or the downward [or lower] and even part of the back of a man; (Msb;) the lower portion of the loins.

qaTinapN *
i. q. HafivN, as its description plainly shows; i. e., the third stomach, commonly called the manyplies, and by some the millet, of a ruminant animal. See rum~aAnapN.

qiToniy~apN * and quToniy~apN [Any kind of pulse, or seed of a leguminous plant that is cooked; this is the general meaning, and includes almost all the particular definitions of the word]: pl. qaTaAniY~u, (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) in the CK erroneously written with the article AlqaTaAniYu.

qaATinN *
A resident. (Msb.)

qayoTuwnN *
A closet; syn. maxodaEN; i. e., a [small] chamber within a [large] chamber. (L in art. sn.)

yaqoTiynN *
A plant (S, K) and the like (K) that has no saAq [or standing stem]; (S, K;) as the gourd-plant and the like: (S:) any tree [or plant] that spreads [or creeps] upon the ground, not rising upon a stem; such, for instance, as the colocynth; but conventionally applied especially to the gourd. (Msb.) See suT~aAHN.

qaTFA *
Sand-grouse; pterocles melanogaster: so Wilkinson, Ancient Egyptians i. 250: see De Sacy's Chrest. Ar., 2nd ed., pp. 369, et seqq.
qaTowapN * : see daAliyapN.

qaTaApN * , of a beast, The croup, or rump, and what is between the hips, or haunches: (K:) or [the fore part of the croup; i. e.] the place where the ridof sits. (S, K.) See AlguraAbaAni. ― -b2- A^adal~u mino qaTaApK: see tub~aEN.
4 A^aqaE~a AlmaA='a * : see A^aEaq~a.
R. Q. 1 qaEoqaEa * : see an ex. voce $an~N.

R. Q. 2 taqaEoqaEa *
It made a sound, or noise; a “ crepitus; ” a succession of sharp, or harsh, sounds, or noises; a creaking, creaking, rustling, clattering, clashing, rattling, &c.: see an ex. voce Sal~a.

qEoqaEapu Als~ilaAHi *
The clash of arms. ― -b2- See EaqoEaqa. ― -b3- qaEoqaEapN A gnashing of the teeth.
maA='N quE~N * or qaE~N: see Euq~N.
maA='N quEaAEN * : see HuraAqN and Euq~N.
ximosN qaEoqaAEN * : see ximosN and xaviyvN.
8 AiqotaEaTa * : see AiEotajara. ― -b2- AlAiqoTiEaATu and AlEim~apu AlT~aAbiqiy~apu signify the same. (O, K, in art. Tbq.)
7 AnqEf * : see AnqEv; He died. (TA, art. qES.)

4 A^aqoEaY *
It (a star) rose high, and then quitted not its place. (TA, art. Erd.)
AlA_iqoEaA'u * : see Eaqiba.

1 qaf~avi AlA^aroDu *
The land had its herbs, or leguminous plants, dried up for want of water. (A, TA, in art. Hf.) [See also qafiy^at, said of land.] ― -b2- qaf~a: see R. Q. 2 in art. jf.
8 AiqotifaAfN * The eating until nothing remains. (Ham, p. 239.)
qaf~N * : see gaf~N.

quf~N *
High ground, (Msb, K,) less than what is termed jabal: (Msb:) or a high portion of the maton of the earth: (S:) or high and rugged ground, not amounting to what is termed jabal. (Sh, TA.)
quf~apN * (pl. qufafN) A basket of the same kind as that called miqoTaf, but larger; smaller than the zanbiyl: i. q. marojuwnapN. (TA in art. Dwn.)
qafiyfN * : see qabiybN: and jafiyfN.

Alqaforu AlyahuwdiY~u *
Jews-pitch, i. e. asphaltum; also called mumia, and in Arabic muwmiyaA: see De Sacy's Abd-allatif, p. 273: and see tiroyaAqN and HumarN.

qafuwrN *
i. q. kaAfuwrN. (IDrd in TA, art. kfr.)

qafo$N *
A boot: (M:) or a short boot: (IAar, K, TA:) or such as is cut, and not well made. (Az, TA.)

4 A^aqofala AlbaAba *
He locked the door. (TK.) See also A^agolaqa.
qafolN * : see faraA$N.
qaAfilN * A slender horse. (TA, art. x$b.)

qaAfilapN *
A company, or an assemblage of persons, travelling together: (El-Fárábee, Msb:) or a company returning from a journey: (S, K:) and commencing a journey; as auguring their return: (El-Fárábee, Msb, K:) he who restricts it to those returning from a journey errs: (ElFárábee, Msb, in which see more:) a caravan.

1 qafaA A^avarahu * and A_itorahu
He followed his track, or footsteps; tracked him. (S, Msb.) ― -b2- qafaA fulaAnFA He followed the footsteps of such a one. (TA.) See qaS~a A^avarahu, which signifies the same, for a better explanation. See also qafawatu A^avarahu.

qafFA * The back of the neck. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b2- EayonaAhu fiY qafaAhu is said of him who is put to flight. because he looks behind him, fearing pursuit.
(TA in art. Anf.) And jaEala A^anofahu fiY qafaAhu: see A^anofN. ― -b3- [Also the back of the hand: and the flat back of a knife and the like.]
qafiy~apN * : see dawaA='u.

qaAfiyapN * , by synecdoche, for *uw qaAfiyapK, (IJ,) (tropical:) A verse; a single verse of a poem. (Akh, Az, TA.) ― -b2- Also, [by a further extension of the proper signification,] A qaSiydap [or an ode, or a poem]. (Az, IJ, TA.)
qaAqawzapN * and qaAfuz~apN: see TaAsN.

1 qal~a * , It was, or became, few; small, or little, in number, quantity, or amount; scanty. ― -b2- huwa yaqil~u Eano ka*aA He, or it, is smaller than, or too small for, such a thing; syn. yaSoguru. (TA.) ― -b3- qal~a labanuhaA Her milk became little, or scanty; she became scant in her milk. ― -b4- qal~a xayoruhu [His good things, or wealth, and his beneficence, became few, or little; scanty, or wanting; he became poor; and he became niggardly:] for qil~apu xayorK signifies “ poverty ” and “ niggardliness. ” (A, TA, in art. Hjd.) And It became scanty, or deficient, or wanting, in goodness. ― -b5- qal~a He had few aiders: sec an ex. voce fal~a.

2 qal~alahu *
He made it, or held it, to be little. (Msb.) ― -b2- He showed it, or made it to appear, to be little, in quantity. (TA.) ― -b3- See 4.

4 A^aqal~ahu *
He lifted it, or raised it, from the ground; and carried it. (Msb.) ― -b2- A^aqal~ahu AlgaDabu (assumed tropical:) Anger disquieted, or flurried, him. (Mj, TA, in art. Hml.) And A^uqil~a [alone] (assumed tropical:) He was disquieted, or flurried, by anger. (T, TA, in that art.) ― -b3- A^aqal~a minohu i. q. ↓ qal~alahu. (M.) ― -b4- A^aqal~a He became poor: (S, Msb:) or he had little property. (K.)
5 taqal~ala * (K, art. nzr) It became diminished, or rendered little or small in quantity. (TK, same art.) ― -b2- taqal~alahu He saw it, or deemed it, to be little in quantity. (TA.)

10 Aisonafal~a *
He was independent, or alone; with none to share, or participate, with him. (TA.) [And Aisotaqal~a binafosihi, the same; or (as shown by an explanation of the act. part. n. in the TA) he managed his affairs, by himself alone, thoroughly, soundly, or vigorously.] And huwa lAa yasotaqil~u bih`*aA He is not able [by himself] to do this. (TA.) ― -b2- Aisotaqal~a He was independent of all others; absolute. ― -b3- Aisotaql~a He (a man) rose, or raised himself, with a burden: (JK:) and a bird in his flight. (JK, K.) ― -b4- Ausotuqil~a gaDabFA He (a man) became affected with a tremour, or trembling, by anger. (JK.) ― -b5- Aisotaqal~a biAl$~aYo'i i. q. Aisotabad~a bihi. (TA in art. Hkr.)

qul~N *
Poverty: see an ex. in a verse cited voce Tal~aAE.
qul~u bonu qul~K * : see Dul~u.

qul~apN * The top, or highest part, of a mountain, &c. (S, K.) ― -b2- The top of the head and hump. (K.) See a verse cited voce Zil~N. ― -b3- qltAni [app. qul~ataAni, or rather qalotaAni, from qlt] The hollows of the two collar-bones (AltrqwtAn). (TA, art. trb.)

qil~apN * [Paucity; smallness; littleness; scantiness; want of due amount of anything: as in qil~apu mubaAlaApK want of due care: or this phrase signifies want of care: also fewness: for] qil~apN sometimes signifies i. q. EadamN. (Mgh in art. HfaZ.) ― -b2- qil~apN may often be well rendered Lack.

qaliylN *
Few; small, or little, in number, quantity, or amount; scanty. ― -b2- A small quantity, or quantum, or number, min maAlK wagayorihi of property, or cattle, &c. ― -b3- qaliylu Alxayori: [see art. xyr, where an explanation is given equivalent to EaAdmu Alxayori: and in like manner] qaliylu Alxayori is used to signify Not making use of oaths at all. (Mgh in art. HfZ.) It may be well rendered Lacking, or destitute of, good, or wealth; as well as having little thereof: it generally means having little, or no, wealth, or good; or lacking, or destitute of, goodness or good things. ― -b4- qaliylN: see maT~aridN. ― -b5- Possessing little, or possessed in a small degree, of anything.
qaliylapN * as a subst., Little: see kaviyrapN.

A^aqal~u maAlFA wawaladFA *
Possessing, or possessor, of less than another in respect of wealth and children: see an ex. (from the Kur xviii. 37) in art. f.

musotaqil~N * A writing on a particular, peculiar, or special, subject. ― -b2- risaAlapN musotaqil~apN A monograph. See also a verse cited voce gatomN. ― -b3- maEonFY musotaqil~N bihi An independent meaning.
AlqilAaSu * , or AlqalAay^iSu, Some small stars before Ald~abaraAnu; [i. e., towards Alt~uray~aA; being between the Hyades and thhe Pleiades;] following Alvry~A. (Mir-át ez-Zemán.) Or The Hyades.

1 qalaEa * and ↓ AifotalaEa He pulled, plucked, tore, wrenched, or rooted, out, or up, or off; detached; removed from his or its place; displaced; (Msb, K *;) eradicated; uprooted; unrooted. (K.) ― -b2- taqolaEu (K in art. j*w) and tqlEu Als~ayora (TA in that art.) [app. for taqolaEu fiY Als~ayori], said of she-camels, (K ib.) [app. They raise their feet clear from the ground: see qaliEN and quloEN: the pret. seems to be qaliEa: so if taqolaEu be the right reading: but in a copy of the K it seems to be tuqoliEu: see jaA*K, art. j*w.

4 A^aqolaEa *
It (rain) left off. (The lexicons passim.) It cleared away; syn. A_inojalaY. (TA.) ― -b2- A^aqolaEa Eanohu He, or it, left him, or quitted him, or it. (Mgh, Msb, K.) He abstained, or desisted, from it. (S.) ― -b3- A^aqolaEa It (hard fortune) departed: see an ex. voce A_ibidN. ― -b4- A^aqolEati AlHum~aY The fever passed away.

5 taqal~aEa fiY ma$oyihi *
He walked as though he were descending a declivity. (TA.)

7 AinoqalaEa *
It became pulled out, or up, or off; became removed from its place, displaced, eradicated, uprooted, or unrooted; it fell, or came, out. You say, A_inoqalaEato A^asonaAnuhu [His teeth fell, or came, out.] (TA, art. Hs.)
8 A_iqotalaEa see 1.
qalaEapN * as meaning Large stones: see mirodFY.
qaloEiY~N * : see raSAaSN and A=nukN; in Turkish qalaAYo.
quluwEN * is a quasi-inf. n. of the verb in the phrase A^aqolaEati AlHum~aY: see Sal~a.
maqolaEN * : see an ex. voce SamogN.

miqolAaEN *
A thing with which one throws a stone; (S;) a sling: (PS:) so in the present day. ― -b2- See also mizoEaqN.
2 qal~afa see 8.

8 Aqotalafa AlZ~ufora *
He pulled out the finger-nail by the root: (Lth, TA:) and so ↓ qal~afahu, accord. to a usage of its pass. part. n. in the T, art. Zfr.
qulofapN * [also The prepuce of the clitoris of a woman;] a piece of flesh between the $uforaAni of a woman, which is cut off in circumcision. (Msb,) voce baZorN.)
A^aqolafu * has also for pl. qulofaAnN: see A^aEoramu.
Q. 2 taqalofaEato Eani Alkamo'i A^anoqaADuhu * [The crusts of earth broke up from over the truffle]. (M, art. nqD.)

1 qaliqa * , aor.
qalaqa , (M, Msb, TA,) inf. n. qalaqN, (S, M, Msb, K,) It was, or became, unsettled, unsteady,
unfixed, loose, mobile, unquiet, or restless; it did not settle, become fixed or motionless or quiet or at rest, or it did not rest or remain or continue, in its place. (TA.) He, or it, became disquieted, disturbed, agitated, flurried, or in a state of unrest or commotion; syn. AinozaEaja, (S, K, TA,) and AiDoTaraba. (M, Msb.) ― -b2- qaliqa A_ilayohi, or AlY liqaAy^ihi, see janaba.
2 qal~aqa see 4.

4 A^aqolaqahu *
He, or it, disquieted him; disturbed him; agitated him; flurried him. (S, Msb.) He moved it, a thing, from its place; as also ↓ qal~aqahu. (M.)

qaliqN *
Unsteady; loose. ― -b2- EibaArapN qaloqapN A loose expression. (TA &c., passim.)

qalaAqapN *
Looseness in an expression. (TA &c., passim.)
qalamN * and ↓ qalamaAni and ↓ qalamaAnN: see jalamN. ― -b2- A writing-reed prepared for writing; a reed-pen.
qalamaAnN * : see qalmN.
muqal~amu AlZ~ufori * and AlA^aZofaAri: see ZufrN.
qalam~asN * : see naAsiy^N.

div2.head: qlw and qlY
div2.entryFree:
1 qalaA * and qlY
He fried wheat; i. e. roasted it in a maqolaY [or frying-pan or roasting-pan]. (Mgh.) ― -b2- qalaY with yaqolaY for its aor.: see A^abaY. ― -b3- huwa yaqoluw Albur~a: see baraY. ― -b4- qalaY He roasted in a frying-pan (MA, KL) flesh-meat (MA) or anything: (KL:) and $awaY signifies the same. (MA.) qalaY Albur~a biAlmiqolaY and AlmiqolAapi means $awaAhu [i. e. he parched, or roasted, the wheat with the mqlY]. (Mgh.) The aor. is yaqoliY and yaqoluw, and the inf. n. qaloYN (MA, Mgh) and qalowN. (Mgh.)

qaloYN *
Potash; as is shown by the explanations in the S, K, and TA. Hence our term “ alkali. ” See HuroDN.

miqolFY *
A frying-pan; i. q. TAajainN. (Msb in art. Tjn.)
1 qam~ahu * : see 4; and vam~ahu, in two places.
4 A^aqam~a AlfaHolu $awolahu * and Al$~awolu ↓ qam~ati: see A^a$omala.

R. Q. 2 taqamoqamotuhu *
I took it, or devoured it, altogether. (TA in art. Eb.)

qumaAmapN *
Sweepings. (S, K.)
miqam~N * A man who eats all that is upon the table. (S, K. *) ― -b2- miqam~N and miqam~apN: see mivam~N.

qumoqumN *
A certain well-known vessel; arabicized from kumokumo; (K, TA;) a vessel of copper, in which water is heated; also called maHam~u; and called by the people of Syria gal~aAyapN; as also qumoqumapN: (Msb:) or a well-known vessel of copper, &c., in which water is heated, narrow in the head: and hence, (tropical:) a small vessel of copper or silver or china-ware, in which rose-water is put [for sprinkling, having a long and narrow neck, with a cover pierced with a hole or with several holes]; (TA;) the vessel of the perfumer: and, with p, a vessel of brass, having two loop-shaped handles, which the traveller takes with him: pl. qamaAqimu. (Msb.)
qamoqaAmapN * : see HalamapN and HamonaAnN and Tab~uwEN.
1 qamaEahu * : see qamaA^ahu.

qamiEu Albusori *
What sticks to the date, around its stalk: (Mgh:) the base of the date. (Mgh, art. *nb.) See vuforuwqN. ― -b2- See also a use of the pl. A^aqomaAE, voce darodaAr. ― -b3- qimaEu AlA^u*uwni The meatus of the ear: see julojulAanN.
1 qamila * : see tiynN.
4 A^aqomala * , said of the rimov: see HanaTa.

qum~alN *
i. q. suwsN: or a kind of quraAd. (Jel, vii. 130.) See saAsa.
muqomilN * : see tiynN.

1 qamaha * , aor.
qamaha , inf. n. qumuwhN, i. q. qamaHa, q. v.

qun~apN *
An isolated mountain. (K, voce jabalN.) See a verse cited in art. Ez.

qin~apN *
Galbanum: so in the present day: see sakobiynajN.
rajulN A^unanapN qunanapN * : see art. An. The last word may perhaps be a mistranscription for funanapN (from fan~u): but this I have not found in art. fn.
qin~iy~apN * The state, or condition, of slavery.

qun~aAbiraY *
A certain herb, or leguminous plant, (baqolapN,) growing forth in the beginning of the rabiyE; a Nabathæan word; called in Arabic tamoluwl [correctly tumoluwl] and gumoluwl; eaten by men; and called in Pers. baroga$ot [correctly baroEasot]; called by the people of Ghazneh viriyod: (O:) correctly with teshdeed to the n, though in most of the copies of the K without teshdeed; and with kesr to the b, as in the Tekmileh. (TA.) See gumoluwlN.
1 qanobaEa * , said of seed-produce or corn: see A^aHonaqa.
qunobuEN * : see rukobaAnu Als~unobuli, voce raAkibN.
qnwr~ * A large, long-bodied man. (Az, in TA, voce hirodab~apN.
qanasN * : see raAsanN.
quwonasN * The [tapering] top of an iron helmet. (K.) See dan~N.

5 taq~anaEa bi$aYo'K *
He was content with a thing. (K, voce tES~b.)

qunoEaAnN * [not qunoEaAnu, as in the CK,] With whom one is contented, or satisfied, (S, K,) like ↓ maqonaEN, (S, K,) in respect of his judicial decision, or his evidence: (K:) used a like as mase. and fem. and sing. and pl. (S, K) and dual. (S.)

qinaAEN *
A woman's covering worn over the ximaAr [or head-covering]; (Msb;) a woman's headcovering, wider than the ↓ maqonaEap. (S, K.) ― -b2- qinaAEu Alqalobi The integument of the heart; the pericardium. (Mgh in art. xlE; and K.)
qaAniEN * , as used in the Kur, xxii. 37, accord. to some, One who asks, or begs. (TA, art. Er.)
maqonaEN * : see qunoEaAnN ― -b2- A_in~a fiY *`lika lamaqonaEFA [Verily in that is a sufficiency]. (S, M, in art. swd.)
muqoniEN * : see SaAfiHN.
miqonaEapN * [and miqonaEN, PS] A woman's head-veil. (MA, PS.)

qunofu* *
maA A^aboyaDu $aTorFA A^asowadu ZahorFA yamo$iY qimoTarFA wayabuwlu qaTorFAIn the original text, the page break is before the final word of the preceding text.
What is white in one half, black in the back, that walks contractedly, and makes water in drops? An enigma: to which the answer is, The qunofu* [q. v.]. (L.) ― -b2- qunofu*u layolK One who sleeps not [during the night]; because the qnf* sleeps not: (L:) and a calumniator; a slanderer; (L, K;) as also A^anoqadu layolK. (L.) ― -b3- Also qunofu*N and qunofa*N The rat, or mouse; syn. faArN: (K:) fem. with p. (TA.) ― -b4- qunofu*N (assumed tropical:) The part behind the ear of a camel, whence the sweat exudes. (S, L, K.) ― -b5- And, with p, (assumed tropical:) The part of the head that is below that which is called the qamaHoduwap. (L.) ― -b6- qunofu*N (assumed tropical:) A place that produces tangled herbage: (S, L, K:) an elevated place abounding with trees: AHn says, that what is thus termed is in hard ground, between what is termed quf~ and sand. (L.) ― -b7- qunofu*u ramolK (assumed tropical:) Sand collected together, (Aboo-Kheyreh, L, K,) and elevated, (K,) or somewhat elevated: (Aboo-Kheyreh, L:) or the abundance of trees of sand: or, as some say, qunofa*u ramolK, with fet-h, signifies abundance and tallness of trees of sand. (L.) ― -b8- qunofu*N (L, K) and with p (L) (assumed tropical:) A tree in the midst of sand. (L, K.) ― -b9- qanaAfi*u (assumed tropical:) Mountains that are not long: or long and narrow tracts, (A^aHobul, L, K, TA: in the CK, A^ajobul, or mountains,) of sand: (L, K:) or hills with pointed heads (nabakN) lying in the way, or road. (Th, L, K.)

qanoqalN *
Half an A_irodab~. (T, voce A_irodab~.) See kur~N.

div2.head: qnw and qnY
div2.entryFree:
1 qaniYa AlHayaA='a *
He kept to the sense of shame, or modesty; (S, K;) he preserved it: and i. q. AisotaHoyaY: and ↓ AisotaqonaY he kept to [or preserved] his sense of shame, or modesty. (TA.) ― -b2- qanaA ganamFA, and ↓ AiqotanaY, He took for himself, got, or acquired, sheep, or goats [for a permanent possession], not for sale. (JK.) ― -b3- qanaA, aor. yaqonuw, inf. n. qunuw~N; a dial. var. of qanaA^a, q. v. (TA.)
3 qaAnaY * : see qaAnaA^a.

8 AqotanaY *
He gained, acquired, or got, for himself, (S, K,) or took for himself, (Mgh,) property, or camels, &c., (S, Mgh,) as a permanent stock, for propagation, (Mgh,) not for merchandise: (S, Mgh:) he made it to be in his possession, not to depart from his hand: (TA:) he acquired it for himself permanently, or for a permanence. See 1.
10 A_isota1o2a3a see 1.
qanFA * of the nose: see $amamN. ― -b2- qnA wu$~aq a name given in Egypt to wu$~aq; also called A^u$~aq and A^u$~aj. (TA in art. A$q.)

qanaApN *
A spear-shaft; (Mgh;) a spear (T, S. K) that is hollow, like a cane; (Az, in TA;) a spear with a head affixed to it. (Msb.) ― -b2- Hence, A subterranean channel, or conduit, for water. (Mgh.) ― -b3- [And A pipe.] ― -b4- qanaApu Alkuwzi The bulobul [or spout] of the kwz [or mug], that pours forth the water. (M, K, in art. bl.) ― -b5- qanaApN, said to signify baqarapN waHo$iy~apN: see fanaApN.
finowapN * : see qiniy~apN.
qinoyapN * and ↓ qinowapN Sheep, or goats, taken for oneself, gotten, or acquired, [for a permanent possession,] not for sale. (JK.)
A^aqonaY * in the prov., xalaAw^uka A^aqonaY liHayAy^ika i. q. A^alozamu [as meaning Most preservative: see that prov. in art. xlw, and see qaniYa AlHayaA='a, above]. (S in art. xlw, and Meyd.)
muqaAnaApN * The weaving with one thread white and one thread black. (T, voce niyrN.)

qahozabN *
Short: (K:) an epithet applied to a man. (TA.)

R. Q. 1 qahoqaha *
He uttered a reiterated (K, TA) and prolonged, (TA,) or a vehement, laughter: (K:) or he laughed, reiterating the sound of qaho. (S, Msb, K.)
qahoqaAhN * : see HaqoHaAqN.

qahoqabN *
Big, bulky, or large in body; as also qahoqamN: (Seer, L:) or the same as an epithet applied to a camel: (TA:) or big, bulky, or large in body, and advanced in years; as also qahoqab~N, (K,) and qarohabN. (TA.) ― -b2- Tall, or long, and having a capacious belly. (K.) ― -b3- Hard, and strong, or robust. (M.) ― -b4- I. q. baA*i nojaAnN; (IAar, K:) as also kahokabN. (TA.)

qahoqamN *
i. q. qahoqabN Big; bulky; large in body. (L.)

5 taqah~ala *
He was, or became, unfrequent in washing and cleansing his person; slovenly with respect to his person. (K.)
qahonabaAnN * : see what follows.

qahan~abN *
Tall, and having a curving back, the upper part bending forward over the breast, or a bent and humped back, or a projecting breast and hollow back; accord. to the different explanations of A^ajonaA^u: or tall; (K;) i. e., in an absolute sense; (TA;) as also ↓ qahonabaAnN. (K.) But AHei and others assert that the n is augmentative. (MF.)

muqahonibN *
Always remaining at the water. (K.)

qaArapN *
A she-bear: see an ex. in art. fTn (conj. 2).
qawoTN * : see an ex. in a verse cited voce raAjilapN.

qaAEN *
An even place; (S, voce maqad~N;) plain, or level, land, (S, Msb,) that produces nothing; (IF, Msb;) plain, or soft, land, (A^aroDN saholapN,) low, and free from mountains. (K.) See also rawoDapN. Respecting its pls., see jaArN.
quwfN * of the ear, The upper part: or the helix: see sak~a and A^asak~u and $anofN. Not to be confounded with fuwqN. ― -b2- quwfN and qaAfN: see SuwfN.
qaAqN * : see faAqN, in two places. ― -b2- AlqaAfu AlmaqoEuwdapN: see art. qEd.
quwqN * : see faAqN.

1 qaAla * . The objective complement of qAl, meaning He said, or what is termed maquwlu Alqawoli, must be a complete proposition, or a word signifying at least one complete proposition, as kalaAmFA; or a word signifying a command or the like; or a word significant of a sound, termed A_isomu SawotK: it may be a verb; but cannot be an inf. n., as EibaAdapN. (Gr.) [This is what is meant where] it is said in the Keshsháf, AlEibaAdapu lA tuqaAlu. (Kull, p. 327.) ― -b2- qaAla lahu signifies xaATaba lh: qAl Eanohu, rawaY Enh: qAl Ealayohi, AifotaraY Elyh: qAl bihi, Hakama bh: and qAl fyh, Aijotahada fiyhi. (Marg. note in Additions to a copy of the KT.) ― -b3- qaAla fiyhi famaA At~araka, i. e. Aijotahada fiyhi: see taraka. ― -b4- qaAla Ealayohi, aor.
qawula , He lied, or said what was false, against him. (TA in art. tlw.) See taqaw~ala. ― -b5- qaAla fiyhi and Eanohu He said of him, or it, such a thing. ― -b6- qaAla bika*aA He asserted his belief in such
a thing, as a doctrine or the like: a well-known meaning. ― -b7- qaAlati AlEayonaAni The eyes made a sign [as though saying...]. (TA.) ― -b8- qaAla biraA^osihi He made a sign with his head: (TA:) or a motion. (Ham, p. 242.) ― -b9- qaAla biyadihi He took [with his hand]. (TA.) ― -b10- qaAla birijolihi He walked, or struck [with his leg, or foot]. (TA.) ― -b11- qaAla bivawobihi He raised his garment. (TA.) ― -b12- qaAla biAlmaA='i EalaY yadihi He poured the water on his arm or hand. (TA.) ― -b13- qaAla fiyhi He spoke against him; vituperated him. ― -b14- qaAla $iEorFA lit., He said, or spoke, or put forth, or uttered, or gave utterance to, or recited, poetry; he spoke in verse; he poetized, or versified. ― -b15- qaAla He made a sign; syn. A^awomaA^a. (Ham, p. 601, where see other meanings: see also p. 242 of the same: and see Mgh.) qaAla biyadihi [He made a sign with his hand, meaning to say...]. (A trad. cited voce HaT~a; and another voce Har~afa.) Also, He struck his hand upon a thing. (Mgh.) See an ex. voce. A^a$oraba.

5 taqaw~ala Ealayohi *
He lied against him. (Har, p. 256.)
8 AiqotaAla Ealayohi * , (S,) or Ealayohimo, (K,) i. q. taHak~ama, (S,) or AiHotakama. (K.) See muw^otaAlN.

qawolN *
A saying; something said: and speech, or diction. ― -b2- SaEuba Ealayohi Alqawolu [Diction, or speech, was, or became, difficult to him]. (K in art. jbl.)
qayolN * and ↓ miqowalN: see zaEiymN.
qiylN * : see exs. voce A^aSobaHa and voce Sir~aY. ― -b2- qiylapN [A saying]. (M, art. A^bd.)
qaAlapN * : see fuw~ahapN, near the end.
qaw~aAlN * , &c., Good in speech: or loquacious; or copious in speech; chaste, or perspicuous, in speech; and eloquent. (K.) ― -b2- A_ibonu A^aqowaAlK The man who talks much. (TA in art. bnY.)

maquwlu Alqawoli *
The thing said: as ka*aA in the phrases qaAla ka*aA and yuqaAlu ka*aA. See qaAla.
miqowalN * : see qayolN.

AlmaquwlaAtu AlEa$oru * , in logic, The Ten Predicaments, or Categories; namely, Aljawoharu Substance, Alkam~u Quantity, Alkayofu Quality, AlA_iDaAfapu Relation, AlA^ayonu Place, or where, AlmataY Time, or when, AlwaDoEu Collocation, or posture, Almiloku Possession, or having, AlfiEolu Action, or doing, and AlA_inofiEaAlu Passion, or suffering.

1 qaAma *
He stood still (Ksh and Bd in ii. 19) in his place. (Ksh.) ― -b2- qaAmati Ald~aAb~apu The beast stopped (S, K, TA) from journeying, (TA,) from fatigue, or being jaded; (S, TA;) i. q. AnqTEt. (A.) And qaAmato Ealayohi Ald~aAb~apu His beast, being jaded, stopped with him, and moved not from its place. (Mgh.) ― -b3- qaAma He, or it, stood up, or erect; syn. AinotaSaba. (K.) And hence, He rose, i. e. from sitting or reclining. ― -b4- qaAma biAll~ayoli He rose in the night to pray. ― -b5- qaAma ramaDaAna He passed the nights of Ramadán in prayer: (El-'Alkarnee in a marginal note in a copy of the Jámi' es-Sagheer, voce mano:) or he performed the prayers [of Ramadán] called Alt~araAwiyH. (En-Nawawee, ibid.) ― -b6- qaAmati AlS~alaApu The people rose to prayer: or the time of their doing so came. (TA.) ― -b7- qaAmati Als~aAEapu The resurrection, or the time thereof, came to pass. ― -b8- qaAmati Al$~amosu wakaAda AlZ~il~u yaEoqilu [The sun became high, and the shade almost disappeared, at midday].
