(JK.) ― -b9- qaAma Ealayohi He rose up against him: see a verse cited voce HuwbN. ― -b10- qaAma biAlA^amori He undertook the affair; took, or imposed, it upon himself; syn. takaf~ala bihi; and the epithet is qaAy^imN and qay~imN: (Ham, p. 5:) [and] he managed, conducted, ordered, regulated, or superintended, the affair; syn. saAsahu; (TA in art. sws;) and qAm Ealayohi has this latter signification; and he tended, or took care of, it, or him; syn. saAsahu and waliyahu: (Ham ubi supra:) [and] the former signifies he attended to the affair; [occupied himself with it]; (this should be the first explanation;) was mindful of it; kept to it constantly, or steadily; and is contr. of qaEada Eanohu and taqaAEada: (JM, q. v.:) [or,] as contr. of qEd Enh and tqAEd, he acted vigorously in the affair; as also ↓ A^aqaAmahu; syn. jad~a fiyhi, and tajal~ada. (Bd in ii. 2.) ― -b11- You say, qaAma bi$aA^onihi He undertook, or superintended, or managed, his affair, or affairs. And you say, qaAma biAlyatiymi, (Msb in art. Ewl,) and biAlS~abiY~i, (Idem, art. kfl,) He maintained the orphan, and the child; syn. EaAlahu, and kafalahu: (Idem:) and qaAma AlmaroA^apa, and EalayohaA, He undertook the maintenance of the woman; or he maintained her; (maAnahaA [i. e. qaAma bikifaAyatihaA (S and K in art. mwn)];) and undertook, or managed, her affair, or affairs. (K.) And Alr~ijaAlu yaquwmuwna EalaY Aln~isaA='i The men govern the women: (Bd, iv. 38:) or are mindful of them, and act well to them, or take care of them. (TA.) ― -b12- qAma biEu*oriY [He undertook, and it served, to excuse me]. (Msb and TA in art. E*r; &c.) ― -b13- qaAma bihi He, or it, was supported, or sustained, by it; subsisted by it: see the explanation of qaiwaAmN in the Msb. ― -b14- qaAma Ealayohi ka*aA It cost him such a thing, such a sum, or so much. ― -b15- qaAma often signifies vabata: so in qaAma fiY nafosihi A^an~ahu ka*aA It was, or became, established in his mind that it was so. ― -b16- qaAma bihi qiyaAmFA taAm~FA He managed it perfectly. ― -b17- qaAma yafoEalu ka*aA He began to do such a thing; he betook himself to doing such a thing. (Zj, in TA, art. qdm.) ― -b18- qaAma AlmaA='u (assumed tropical:) The water congealed, or froze; syn. jamada. (S, M, voce jamada.) ― -b19- qaAmato Eayonuhu: see EayonN qaAy^imapN. ― -b20- qaAma qaAy^imu AlZ~ahiyrapi: see Zahiyrap: there expl. from JK. ― -b21- qaAma waqaEada: see qaEada; and A^aqoEadahu; and see an ex. voce sud~apN. ― -b22- qaAma has also for an inf. n. maqaAmN, agreeably with a general rule: see Bd in x. 72, &c.; and see maraAmN in art. rwm.

2 qaw~amahu *
He made it straight, or even; namely, a crooked thing; as also ↓ A^aqaAmahu: (TK:) and made it right, or in a right condition; direct, or rightly directed. ― -b2- qaw~amahu bika*aA He valued it, or rated it, as equal to, or worth, such a thing. A phrase well known, and used in the present day. ― -b3- qaw~amahu He set its price; assigned it its price; valued it; (S, * Msb, K;) as also ↓ AisotaqaAmahu. (Msb, K.) ― -b4- ↓ qaw~amotuhu fataqaw~ama i. q. Ead~alotuhu fataEad~ala. (Msb.) ― -b5- qaw~ama He made a writing, and an account, or a reckoning, accurate, or exact, or right.

3 qaAwamahu * [He rose against him, and withstood him, or opposed him, in contention;] namely, his adversary. (Mgh in art. nhD.) ― -b2- It was equal, or equivalent, to it. (Msb.) ― -b3- qaAwamahu fiY AlHarobi He opposed him, or contended with him for equality, in war, or battle. (MA.) ― -b4- qaAwamahu fiY HaAjapK He rose, or stood, with him [or assisted him] to accomplish some needful affair. (IAth, TA.) ― -b5- qaAwamahu It was equal, or equivalent, to it: see Msb: syn. EaAdalahu, q. v. (TA in art. bwA^.) ― -b6- yuqaAwimu Als~umuwm [It counteracts poisons]. (TA, art. bls.)

4 A^aqaAma *
He set up, put up, set upright, a thing. (Msb.) ― -b2- A^aqaAmahu, said of food, [It sustained him, supported him]. (Msb.) ― -b3- A^aqaAma EalaY xaTarK He stood to a bet, wager, or stake. (TA, voce nadiabN.) ― -b4- A^aqaAma Ealayohi AlH~ada He inflicted upon him the punishment termed Had~N. (Mgh, art. Hd.) ― -b5- A^aqaAma daroA^ahu: see drA^. ― -b6- A^aqaAma lilS~alaApia, inf. n. A_iqaAmapN, He (the mubal~ig) recited the form of words called A_iqaAmap, q. v. infra. ― -b7- A^aqaAma He remained, continued, stayed, tarried, resided, dwelt, or abode, in a place: he remained stationary. ― -b8- A^aqaAma AlS~alaApa, He observed prayer: or A^adaAma fiEolahaA. (S, Msb.) See also Bd, and Jel ii. 2. ― -b9- A^aqaAma fiEolFA He performed an action. ― -b10- See 1. ― -b11- A^aqaAmahu EalaY AlT~ariyqi He made him to keep to the road: and llqaSodi, to the right way. (L, art. lgd.) ― -b12- See 10. ― -b13- A^aqaAama AlA^amora He put the affair
into a right state; like naZamahu: see the latter in the Msb. ― -b14- A^aqaAmahu (K in art. Edl) He made it to be conformable with that which is right; namely, a judgment, a judicial decision. (TK in that art.) ― -b15- See 2. ― -b16- A^aqaAma bihi in the Hamáseh, p. 75, 1. 9, app. signifies He stood in his stead. ― -b17- A^aqaAma He observed, or duly performed, a religious, or moral, ordinance or duty. ― -b18- A^aqaAma Albay~inapa [He established the evidence or proof; and so AqAm bihaA? the b being redundant]. (Bd, iii. 68.) And [in like manner,] AqAm Huj~atahu i. q. A^avobatahaA; (TA in art. vbt;) and so, app., biHuj~atihi; the b being redundant, as in an ex. voce xuT~apN; but this is the only ex. that I know, and it is without explanation: Golius mentions the phrase A^aqaAma biY Ealayokumo; but without indicating his authority. ― -b19- A^aqaAma EalaY HaAlK He abode, or continued, in a state, or condition; and AqAm ElY A^amorK the same; and he abode, continued, stayed, or waited, intent upon, or occupied in, an affair, a business, or a concern; he kept to it.

5 taqaw~ama *
It subsisted: see rukonN. ― -b2- taqaw~ama It had a price; was valued. ― -b3- See 2.

6 taqaAwamuwhu fiymaA bayonahumo *
They valued it, or estimated its price, among them. (TA.)

10 AisotaqaAma *
It became right; direct; in a right state; straight: even: tended towards the right, or desired, point, or object; had a right direction, or tendency; was regular. ― -b2- AisotaqaAma EalaY Tariyqi AlHaq~i (K, art. r$d) He continued in the way of truth, or the right way; as also Ealayohi ― -b3- A^aqaAma? ― -b4- lamo yasotaqimi AlA^amoru The affair was, or became, difficult: see taEa*~ara. ― -b5- AstqAm lahu AlA^amoru The affair, or case, became in a right state for him; syn. AiEotadala. (S.) ― -b6- AisotaqaAma He, or it, was, or became, right, direct, rightly directed, undeviating, straight, or even: and he, or it, stood right, or straight, or erect. (MA, KL.) He went right on, straight on, or undeviatingly: (see zaEaba:) whence AisotaqaAma EalaY AlT~ariyqapi he went on undeviatingly in the way. (See Kur lxxii. 16.) He went right; pursued a right course; acted rightly, or justly. See also sad~a, with which it is syn. It (an affair) was direct in its tendency, or had a right tendency. It (discourse, &c.) had a right tenour. ― -b7- See 2.

qawomN * [A people, or body of persons composing a community: and people, or persons:] a company, or body, [or party, (see what follows,)] of men, [properly] without women: (S, Msb, K, &c.:) or of men and women together; (K;) for the qwm of every man is his party, and his kinsfolk, or tribe: (TA:) or (K) sometimes including women, as followers; (S, Msb, K;) for the qwm of every prophet is of men and women. (S, Msb.) ― -b2- qawomN opposed to nisaA='N: see a verse cited voce sawofa.

qaAmapN * The stature of a man; his height in a standing posture; it is a span ($ibor) shorter than a bAE: (JK:) tallness, height; and beauty, or justness, of stature. (K.) ― -b2- qaAmapN A structure [or post] like the figure of a man, raised at the side of a well, whereon is placed the wood to which the pulley is attached: pl. qaAmN: (JK:) also called ↓ qaAy^imapN: see K, voce Eamuwd: or qaAmapu AlbakorapN signifies the sheave (bakorap) with its apparatus. (S, K.)

diynN qiyamN *
A right religion. (Kur, vi. 162.) See dir~apN.

Alr~iyaAHu Alquw~amu *
The right [or cardinal] winds. (S, voce nakobaA'u.)

Ald~iynu Alqay~imu * (Kur ix. 36) The right, correct, or true, reckoning. (T in art. dyn.) ― -b2- qay~imu AlA^amori i. q. ↓ muqiymuhu and saAy^isuhu: fem. qay~imapN. (TA.) ― -b3- qay~imN biAlA^amori A manager of an affair; i. q. A_izaAw^uhu. (S, Msb, art. AzY.) See qaAma biAlA^amori. ― -b4- qay~imN A manager, conductor, orderer, regulator, or superintendent, of an affair: (TA:) a manager, conductor, &c., of the affairs of a people. (JK.) qay~imN EalaY AlmaAli A good [manager and] tender of camels, &c. (TA in art. blw.)
qiymapN * The real value, or worth, of a thing; its equivalent; differing from vamanN, q. v. (MF in art. vmn.)

qawaAmN *
Stature, and goodly stature, or tallness, of a man: (S:) symmetry, or justness of proportion. (Msb.) ― -b2- qiwaAmu AlA^amori and qiyaAmuhu and qawaAmuhu The stay, or support, of the thing, or affair, whereby it subsists, and is managed and ordered. (Msb.) And qiwaAmN The food that is a man's support; (Msb;) [his subsistence.] ― -b3- qiwaAmN [The main stay of a thing.] ― -b4- laA qiwaAma lahu bihi [He has not power to withstand him. (K, art. njz.)

qiwaAmN *
Subsistence: see rukonN and TabaEN.
qiyaAmN * [A state of purging, or flux of the belly: used in this sense in the S, K, voce hayoDapN].
qawiymN * : see SawiybN.
Alqay~uwmu * : see yaA qay~uwmu in the last paragraph of art. $rh, where I have rendered it on the authority of an explanation in the TA.
qaw~aAmN * One who rises much, or often, in the night to pray. (TA.) See Saw~aAmN.
quwmiy~apN * is written with damm in copies of the S, K, JK: in the CK, erroneously, qawomiy~apN, in both senses. See voce muta$am~isN.

qaAy^imN *
Appearing; conspicuous; [as though standing before one]: said of a thing whether standing or thrown down. (TA, in explanation of the phrase h`*aA nuSobu EayoniY, art. nSb.) ― -b2- qaAy^imapN, pl. qawaAy^imu, Leg of a horse, &c. ― -b3- EayonN qaAy^imapN An eye [blind, or white and blind, but still whole or] that has become white and blind, but not yet burst, (AZ in L, art. sd,) or sightless, but with the black still remaining. (Mgh, Msb.) ― -b4- qaAy^imN and qaAy^imapN The hilt of a sword. (Msb.) ― -b5- qaAy^imapN A leg of a table, and of a throne, or moveable seat, &c. (JK.) See also qaAmapN; and see A_isonaAdN. ― -b6- qawamapu bayoti Aln~aAri (K, art. hrb*.) The servants of the fire-temple. (TA, same art.) ― -b7- AlqawaAy^imu The winds. So in a verse of Umeiyeh Ibn-Abi-s-Salt. (TA, voce sadirN.) ― -b8- qawaAy^imu AlmaAy^idapi [The legs of the table]. (K, art. Eqr.) ― -b9- qaT~N qaAy^imN A nibbing in which the pith and the exterior of the reed are made of equal length: opposed to muSaw~abN. (TA in art. Hrf.) ― -b10- maA='N qaAy^imN Frozen water. And stagnant water: see HibaAk.

A_iqaAmapN * The form of words chanted by the mubal~ig, not by the muw^a*~in, consisting of the common words of the A^a*aAn, with the addition of qado qaAmati AlS~alaApu (The time of prayer has come!) pronounced twice after HaY~a EalaY AlfalaAHi. See vaw~aba.

maqaAmN * The place of the feet; (K;) a standingplace; (S, Msb;) as also ↓ muqaAmN: (S:) or the latter, a place of stationing: (Msb:) and both, a place of continuance, stay, residence, or abode: (K:) [a standing:] and the latter, a place of long continuance, stay, residence, or abode: (Expos. of the Mo'allakát, Calc., p. 138:) and both, continuance, stay, residence, or abode. (S, K.)
muqaAmN * : see maqaAmN.

muqiymN *
Lasting; continuing: (Bd, ix. 21:) unceasing. (Bd, ix. 69.) ― -b2- A^axa*ahu Almuqiymu AlmuqoEidu: see art. qEd. ― -b3- See qay~imN.

maqaAmapN *
A standing-place. Hence, (assumed tropical:) A sittingplace. Hence, (assumed tropical:) The persons sitting there. Hence, (assumed tropical:) An oration, or a discourse, or an exhortation, (xuTobap Aw EiZap,) or the like, there delivered; as also majolisN. (Mtr, in De Sacy's ed. of El-Hareeree, p. 5.)
HajarN mutaqaw~imN * (K, art. mws) A precious stone. (TA, same art.)
taqowiymaAtN * [pl. of taqowiymN] Stellar calculations. (TA, voce AiyjN.)
quwhapN * : see fuw~ahapN, last sentence.

1 qawiYa * and ↓ taqaw~aY (S, K) and ↓ AiqotawaY (K) He became strong: (S, K:) vigorous, robust, or sturdy; like Ai$otad~a, or the last signifies he became excellent in strength. (TA.) ― -b2- qawiYa Ealayohi He had strength, or power, sufficient for it; or he had strength, or power, to endure it; he prevailed against it; namely, travel, adversity, &c. And He or it, prevailed over him, or it. ― -b3- See 4. ― -b4- qawiYa is [said to be] originally qawiwa, because it is from Alquw~apu: (I'Ak, p. 368:) but Lth holds quw~apN to be [anomalous,] originally quwyapN. (TA.) I prefer the former opinion, and think it should be mentioned in art. qw, or I would rather head this art. qw or qwY, like gw or gwY. ISd holds quw~apN to be from qww, like vuw~apN, q. v. from vww.
2 qaw~aAhu * : see $ad~ahu. ― -b2- qaw~aAniY Ealayohi: see 2 in art. Twq.

3 qaAwaAhu *
He vied with him, strove to surpass him, or contended with him for superiority, (S, K,) in strength: (TA:) i. q. $aAd~ahu. (A, L in art. $d.)

4 A^aqowati Ald~aAru *
The house became empty, vacant, or unoccupied; (S, Mgh, Msb, K;) as also ↓ qawiyat. (S, K.)

5 taqaw~aY *
He strengthened himself; made himself, or constrained himself to be, strong; affected, or endeavoured to acquire, strength. See 1. ― -b2- taqaw~aY mina Al$~aYo'i biqawomihi: see taman~aEa.
8 A_iqotawaYa see 1.

fuw~apN *
Strength, power, potency, might, or force; contr. of DaEofN; (S, K;) in body, and in intellect: (TA:) vigour, robustness, or sturdiness; like $id~ap. ― -b2- quw~apN A strand; i. e., a single twist of a rope; a yarn; a distinct, and separately twisted, portion, of two or more which, being twisted together, compose the whole, of a rope, and of a string, or thread. See also vinoYN. ― -b3- A faculty. Ex. Als~amoEu quw~apN fiY AlAu*uni bihaA tudoriku AlA^aSowaAta [AlsmE is a faculty in the ear by which it perceives sounds]. (TA in art. smE.) ― -b4- biAlquw~api Potentially, or virtually; as opposed to biAlfiEoli, i. e. actually. ― -b5- quw~apu lafoZK: see layota.
bit~u qawiyFA * , and qaAwiyFA, and muqowiyFA: see gawFY and gawiY~N in art. gw.
qay~aAsN * : see qaw~aAsN.
maqiysN * (not muqay~asN) Consistent with analogy.
miqoyaSN * : see maqowasN.
1 qaADa * : see AnqAS, art. qyS.
7 A_inoqaADa * : see AnqAS, art. qyS.
munoqaADN * : see munoqaASN.
qayoZiY~N * : on the nitaAj thus called see SafariY~N.

qiyqaA='N * , (K, voce talotalapN; S, K, voce rafaDa, and voce waliyEN; K, voce juf~N; &c.,) or qiyqaA='apN, (S, voce talotalapN; and TA,) and qiyqaA^apN, (TA,) or qiyqaApN and qiyqaAyapN, (JK,) The envelope (qi$or, JK, or wiEaA=', TA) of the TaloE [or spadix of the palm-tree]; (JK, TA;) which is made into a drinking-vessel, like the talotalap: (JK:) the qiyqaA=' of the TaloE is the envelope (gi$aA=') that is with the waliyE. (K, voce juf~N.)
qiyqN * and see faAqN.
quyAaqN * : see faAqN.
qyqA' * see voce HarabN and K, voce waliyEN and juf~N.

1 qaAla *
He slept during midday: (Mgh:) or he stayed during midday. (TA, art. hjr.) ― -b2- qay~ala: see another meaning, voce bay~ata.
3 qaAyalahu AlbayoEa * [He dissolved, rescinded, or annulled, with him the sale]. (A, art. rd.)

4 A^aqaAla A@ll~`hu Eavorataka * , and EivAaraka, [May God cancel thy slip, lapse, fault, wrong action, or mistake: (A, art. Evr:) may God raise thee from thy fall. (Msb, art. qyl.) A^aqaAlahu Eavoratahu He forgave him his slip, lapse, or fault. (MA.)
5 taqay~ala A^abaAhu * : see taqay~aDa and taA^as~ala.

10 AisotaqAala AlbayoEa *
He desired, or demanded, the rescinding of the sale, or purchase. (MA.) And AstqAl AlEanowapu He desired, or demanded, his passing over, or forgiving, the slip, lapse, or fault. (MA.) See also Har, p. 7. See also a verse cited voce EanowapN.
qaAy^ilapN * : see gaAay^irahN.

maqiylN *
A resting-place; syn. musotaqar~N: hence, maqiylu AlHub~i [the resting-place of love] and maqiylu AlgayoZi [the resting-place of wrath], applied by El-Mutanebbee to the heart. (W, i. 112.) See an ex. (mistranslated) in De Sacy's Ar. Gr., sec. ed., ii. 165: the same, with a var., in Ibn-Akeel p. 210.
qayonN * The part, of a camel, that is the place of the shackle, or hobble. (Ham, p. 558.) See a verse of Dhu-r-Rummeh, voce daAnaY.
